I noticed while trying on the suit, the fabric on the bottom looked very thin and cheap (this is not noticeable on top as there is padding to make up for it).  So after I took the suit off, I got the bottom wet and you can the back of the bottom is shear.  The front is fine due to extra lining, but I don't need to walk around a beach or pool with people being able to see my tush cheeks.

I've been wearing these pants over the last month, 5 or 6  times.  They are incredibly comfortable and surprisingly stylish.  Love them.  They lost no color in the wash and can be ironed back into original condition easily.

Very nice pants.  Arrived promptly, too.

Addendum 5/6/17.  I still love these pants but there seems to be a bit of false advertising going on.  I don't think these are true linen fabric.  I used the water test on them and it didn't seep through.  It would be nice to try the burn test but that would damage the pants.  Many of the products now out of China are labeled "linen" but are actually polyester fibers.

I'd still recommend them, so comfortable, but that sort of takes the shine off the product knowing they aren't true linen.  Hopefully, one of these Chinese fashion houses on Amazon can come clean and lift the veil on this practice.

One star deducted.
summary: Addendum. They are incredibly comfortable and surprisingly stylish

Better than I expected. Not only was the material super comfy, the fit was perfect. The materials feel like they are good quality and will last a while too. The padding is enough so that nipples won't show through, and they come out easily for washing. These will most likely replace my bras. I'm attaching a photo of these next to my normal type bra (size 34A) and they look so similar, it's basically the slip on version of my bra.
I can't speak about fit on other sizes, but I just stretched it out with my hand while wearing it, and it has very good elasticity and will just expand to your band size, and the pads of course will follow.

Because if you think about it, bras cups usually just "cradle" the *sides* of your boobs- they don't cover them entirely. This is what makes the flexibility of this bralette. If you're small like me, it will basically cover them entirely while still preserving the curvature and covering nipples. If you're a larger bust, then its coverage will function like a regular bra - cupping just the sides. So there are two parts: band size and cup size. The limit of this bra would be (1) when the band has to stretch so much that its elasticity will lose tension over time and/or (2) when the cups are covering way less than just the "sides" and you feel like you're spilling. I don't foresee any issues with issue#1, as it is extremely stretchy, but I think potentially if you're like a DDD, then the cup coverage might be unacceptably inadequate for you.
I suppose there is potentially a (3)rd issue with the straps' strength, as some may rely on straps to withstand drooping. Not sure at what point the straps would give out.

Well, I just dissected the theory of the function and build of bras haha, but I hope that this helps conceptualize the "one size fits all" for people who are hesitant, and also specify things to consider if they have particularly large busts. I wish these were made in the USA instead of China, just because I like to support local (or closer to local) economy.

I really like these bra tops.  The v neck front is very attractive and they have a smaller back than some other similar types of bras.  In other words they look like a sexy bra instead of a rectangle of cloth strapped around your bosom.

 I had come to believe that if I wanted a stretchy sport bra with some padding it was going to have to be one of those boxy cylinders that are the same width in the front as in the back.  These Anemone have proved to me I can have comfort, some light padding and a great look all rolled into one.  I am getting more in different colors.

Update 1/18/2016
I found these bras so delightful I made a second purchase.  My original ones are holding up perfectly.  They create a perfect look under even clingy shirts.
Very nice, but not good for a big boobs.  I got this for my newly purchased boobs, which are now a D cup, and no go.  If you are a C or below this should be a good fit for you.
summary: Very nice, but not good for a big boobs

reviewText:
absolutely beautiful necklace, and very well made! The clasp is easy to operate and is very strong. I was a little worried about the pearls catching the hairs on the back of my neck (seems to happen with most products like this) but I have had NO issue with that at all.
This necklace seriously matches almost any outfit, and I've been wearing it for 4 days now because of that! The pearls are very pretty and delicate, and the twisting of the different stands adds a unique visual texture to the piece.
The large pearl in the silver setting sits nicely at the hollow of my neck, and moves freely, so I never end up with a necklace that looks off-center haha.
Overall, this is an incredibly pretty necklace. The sparkling crystals and high-shine silver accent the beautiful pearls in a way I didn't expect. The combination of both materials makes this necklace look classic AND contemporary! I absolutely love it so far, and would highly recommend it to others. I think that this style would suit both young and more mature alike, and look good on any age! Definitely a big hit with me, and I can be a little hard-to-please with jewelry haha. I mentioned how well-made it is, but just to clarify, my son has pulled on this necklace several times, and I have not been worried about it breaking at all. It's made to be durable, and to last. I'm VERY happy with my choice!

I did receive this product at a discount/free in exchange for an honest review. I strive to provide fellow consumers with the most detailed, unbiased and (hopefully) helpful reviews that I can, believing that allowing a discount to influence a review is a disservice to other shoppers. Therefore, anything contained in this review can be considered my own independent and unbiased thoughts and opinions, that have not been influenced in any way. I hope I've provided helpful information.
summary: beautiful, classic AND contemporary! Love it!

reviewText: I'm pretty happy with this swimsuit... For the MOST part... So I'm 5'2 and weigh around 125 ibs. I'm pretty small but nit over the top small kind of average. Anyways, when I first got this swim suit I loved it! I wore it to hotels that had a swimming pool with my best friend and her family. It was beautiful and perfect. I'll post some pictures to show you what it looks like. It's a pure beautiful white. It's so cute but it doesn't seem exactly as the same as the picture shows. The picture shows the v is pretty sharp and defined to help define ur cleavage. Mine somewhat created a sharper v neck after the fourth or fifth time I swam in this swim suit. I had to wear it out. It sagged more and more in the middle in between the boobs which helped form the perfect v shape. However it kept sagging more and more each time so I have to tie it tighter and pull the top higher up each time bc if I didn't I would feel a gap of water enter my top when I would swim under and water pushed up against me. So I KNEW my actual tits were showing so I would have to come up and adjust it tighter and pull the actual padding and top up higher. It worked temporarily but I shouldn't have to worry about that. The bottom fits pretty well though. I have a pretty big booty id say and I ordered a small so the bottom showed a little more than what I wanted but I was a gymnast so I was used to the feeling. And it wasn't a lo showing anyways. Definitely shows off my figure pretty well. I think they need to put more work into the top though. Here's some pictures to help you get a feel. Btw I'm usually a small so I ordered a small. And it arrived early
summary: It's okay. Happy for the MOST part

reviewText: I couldn't help but laugh at the reviews. Some complained because the fringe was upside down.. That's because they were wearing the top upside down. If you don't like a little cleavage and cheekiness this isn't for you, but I love the way it fits.

I normally take a large and purchased the 2X Large, which fits me perfectly.  I bought these for meditation/lounge wear and they are comfortable without being to baggy. For the price, this is a great dress, and totally usable as a wedding dress.  My only comments on quality would be that the boning in mine wasn't placed very well, so that the "peak" of the boob on the left side was too high, but the right one was normal, so there was a weird mismatch.  Also, the seam on the right side of the bodice had a little bit of excess fabric, so there was a weird little flap over the right boob.  That being said, these were not flaws that you'd notice unless you were really scrutinizing, and I don't think someone who was just looking at you in the dress would come close to noticing.

Quality aside, in my opinion, the buttons that go down the back are a bit large and spaced out, so it doesn't get that classic effect.  I also thought the sequins were a bit chafing, but that's inevitable with sequins.

Lastly, since I don't think it says in the product description, the material is 100% polyester.

reviewText: Other than a slightly popped stitch (which can be easily fixed) this purse arrived just as described. The size is perfect for carrying my average sized paperbacks and (approximately) 6in x 9in hardbacks.  I have included example pictures of books that fit in the bag. A hardback copy of Catching Fire fits perfectly and a hardback copy of Inkdeath (6.25 in x 8in) fits but takes a little more effort to close the magnetic closures of the bag.  My copy of Brisingr (9.25in x 6in) did not fit in the bag. Any book that is almost the same dimensions as the purse probably would not fit. I realize that not everyone is going to use this purse to carry books but I hope that the book dimensions give you an idea of the size of the bag.  I am planning to use this purse as a cute and fashionable way to carry and protect my books. It is my "book-bag" in more than one way: it looks like a book and it will also carry my books. I have included photos of the length width and height of the bag as well as example photos of what book sizes fit in it. The bag also has a small zipper compartment and a small pocket across from the zipper compartment. I will most likely use these for papers, business cards, etc. I highly recommend this bag for anyone who loves books, I was excited to finally buy it this week and I was not disappointed!
summary: Perfect quirky bag for a book lover like me.

reviewText: I love this purse!!  The wallet was a little to big for the purse, but I still like it.

I just received my purse today, and I love it.. it even looks better then the photo. I will order again
from Texas West.

I loved the photo of the purse online, but when I opened the box, I fell in love with it!  This is the fourth purse I've ordered from Texas West, and they've all been beautiful.  This purse is well-made of quality leather with embellishments that are securely fixed.

As an added bonus, there's an awesome matching wallet that is of great quality as well.  It has its own (detachable) thin shoulder strap and wrist strap, so the wallet can be carried by itself, hands-free.  The wallet is roomy enough for a smaller, thinner phone, and has plenty of credit card & other slots.

Back to the purse!  It is just the right size for everything that I carry - not too large and overpowering, and definitely not too small or inadequate.  I put my Epi-Pen in the concealed carry zippered pocket, along with my business card case and another small item.  It zipped up with ease.  In the main compartment, I have the wallet, an asthma inhaler, and other items, and there's plenty of space left over.  The strap adjusts to a fairly long length, which makes it perfect for wearing cross-body.

Besides this purse and wallet being incredibly functional, they're beautifully made!  And Texas West, the seller, has great customer service!  They shipped out the purse almost immediately, and I received it in perfect condition in just a few days.  I contacted them with a question, and they replied very politely right away.

I'd highly recommend this set to anyone who likes a touch of pizzazz in their purses!  And you can't go wrong buying it from Texas West - I can't speak for any other sellers that might have similar products.

Also I like them darker so they match my blue jeans which I like wearing. Having said that.... the style and quality are great! I get compliments all the time when wearing it!!

reviewText:
The necklace and story, comes from the anime, Sword Art Online. (Episode 11, Girl of the Morning Dew. An episode 12, Yui's Heart) In which Kirito saves Yui from deletion, by placing her program into a crystal. This is then given to Asuna, who wears it around her neck. Praying that one day, the three can be reunited.

The anime like others, has gotten a foothold into the hearts of many. So finding anything from the show of quality, takes time and money. For the cheap crap out there, will only end up adding to the overfilling landfills.

What I like about this necklace -
The teardrop shape is closer to the image seen in the anime. (Thou the true teardrop, is slightly longer.)
Its colored blue. (Not clear.)
The cord, is not a chain.
Its not some tiny little dot, you'd need to look at under a microscope.
There's some weight to the teardrop, but nothing too heavy. That it would become annoying, to wear.
The extension chain that's used, to adjust the size of the cord. Is not cheap, nor is the clasp. Both are made well, an should last, if handled with care.

What I dislike about this necklace -
The cord is some form of rubber. So if you have allergies to such material, which it says on the back of the package. (Some materials may irritate sensitive skin.) Replace the cord with something else, immediately.

Overall, I've only seen one necklace that comes closer to the images below. its either sold out, no longer made or was professional made for someone they love. (The cord was similar to this one, the little upside down Y. That hold the teardrop to the cord, again like the image. All for the teardrop, being slightly longer. Oh, an it was blue in color.)

Images are of - Size, front, back and those from the anime.
summary: Not exact, but very made well.

It's scary & might make you hide it in a drawer!  But it's a great dress to wear around the house on the weekends.  And as I stated, it's a piece of inspiration for me.  I've had 5 surgeries onmy back, gained 30+ pounds and am lacking motivation to work through the pain & start exercising all over again,

For those that say it's poor quality material, it is exactly what the description states, polyester/spandex.  It's what most sundresses and summer dresses are mare of these days..  It's also a $14 dress, the dress is meant to hug your body & be sexy.  And a 3X is not a US 3X.

I hope this review helps.  Just remember that the rounded pattern on the back is RIGHT on your butt.  So if you don't like attention directed to your bottom, maybe go with a different pattern.  ;-)

reviewText:
Overall, I am happy with this purchase. I have been wanting stone plugs for a long time, but never got around to it because most of them are pretty pricey. When I saw a 3-pair pack for such a low price, I had to do it!

The plugs were shipped pretty quickly and in appropriate packaging. The plugs themselves seem very sturdy and tough, without being obnoxiously heavy. They're super easy to clean as well.

The only complaint I do have is that the width of the plugs is pretty thin...and the flare is really subtle, both these things means my plugs are falling out multiple times a day.  All of my other pairs are somewhat thick so that it can hold you whole earlobe. With these ones, my ear always ends up being "pushed out" by my earlobe and I have to reinsert them so many times through out the day. And I have pretty normal ears/lobes.

All in all, I love these plugs and have been alternating between the three pairs daily for the last 3 months ive had them! I've gotten loads of compliments and asked about where I got them. I would definitely purchase again if I needed to!
summary: One small complaint, but these are awesome!

reviewText: These are adorable.  My wife and I have a personal saying about stars and the moon and these help me think of that every day.  Simple and understated they fit with almost any outfit.  No allergic reactions and easy to put on and take off.

These earrings are really cute and just what I was looking for.  Unfortunately, when I received them, the earring backs were not on the posts.  It was incredibly difficult to push the backs onto the posts which ultimately ended up bending the posts a little.  I was able to easily bend them back.  They are small and perfect for a second hole.  Besides the earring back concern, I'd recommend these to others.

Please note that I received this product at a discounted price to provide my honest feedback of it.

I like it. It's very cute, but the silver earring backs hole was too small. I couldn't use that one, so I used the rubber one instead. I just wish that these are a big bigger. I would buy another one if it's bigger!  I received this product in exchange for a review.

Simply put, these are the smallest earrings I've ever seen!  I was expecting these to be a normal adult stud-size, but when they came, it appears they may be better suited for infants.  They came packaged in a plastic bag, with no hang tag or gift box -- so these certainly aren't suitable for gift-giving, unless you feel like hunting down your own box.  The earrings came with two sets of backs, one rubber, one silver.  My other disappointment was that the "moon" earring was rounded at one end and looked less like a moon and more like a swoosh. If you look at the item photos, there are two different styles pictured, one where the moon is more rounded, and one where the moon is pointed and actually looks like a moon -- I received the more rounded look.  I attempted to return these and was told it wasn't eligible for return.  I contacted amazon customer service and explained that these were very much different than I expected, and they refunded my money.  I received this product at a discount in exchange for leaving my HONEST review.

These are small and dainty and perfect for a small child or as a secondary set of earrings. Or if you like really small earrings, these will be right up your alley. They come with a thin post but it is firmly affixed to the star and moon shape. They don't have standard metal backs but instead have the rubber backs. I like those better anyway since I think they tend to stay on better.

I've had no reaction or problems wearing them. Sample provided for review.
summary: Petite and Dainty, Comfortable to Wear

I love polka dots and really wild socks, so I'm really disappointed with these socks.  Sadly, I am sending them to the Salvation Army.  I wear a kid's size 2/woman's size 4 shoe, so I got the smallest size offered.  I also have fairly slender ankles.

Upside: these are well-made socks, overall.  Nothing terribly "cheap" about them.  They're also bright, and really cute.

Downside: the foot-length of the sock is okay, BUT -  the ankles are SO tight that my feet actually swelled - and my feet/ankles don't EVER swell.  The ankle band (narrow) left a deep, long-lasting dent all the way around my ankle, and my feet and ankles hurt for quite a few hours after removing the socks.  So, unless you have pencil-ankles, you might want to keep shopping.

I spent a great deal of time trying to find a skeleton-style watch on Amazon and selected this one as a gift for myself.  I love the overall style, the exposed mechanism, the glass and stainless steel backing, the self-winding components, the decorative/functional screws around the outside of the watch crystal.  This is a distinctive watch that has received several compliments from strangers when they see it on my wrist.

I did not understand that the watch winding stem had a screw-off adjustment design until I re-read another buyers online review, but now this makes sense to me.  Shipping time was better than expected, especially in the weeks prior to the US holidays.

A very nice watch and a solidly positive buying experience.

reviewText: THE SMELL! this belt smells of cheap would-be-leather .. it's just awful. it reeked right out of the box so I aired it out for a couple days before deciding to return it. The smell was still there. The materials are obviously cheap or the glue is awful or something but it smells like the inside of a cheap shoe store that has been in need of maintenance. I also didn't like the buckle mechanism as much as some other belts of this nature sold on amazon. I am returning this without having worn it once. I'm giving it more than 1 star because it DOES work.. the ratchet is there and it WILL hold your pants up.. but you could get a much better belt with the same functionality and without that god-awful smell.

Purchased in April of 2016. Belt was fantastic for first 4 months, however the quality of leather used quickly ripped at the buckle end, forcing me to cut and shorten the belt multiple times. After 6 months, the buckle disintegrated and I'm stuck at work with pants that keep falling. Not recommended at any price. Stick with MissionBelt or SlideBelt-- I learned my lesson trying to purchase cheap. SlideBelts Men's Animal-Friendly Leather Belt without Holes - Silver Buckle / Black Leather (Trim-to-fit: Up to 48" Waist) Mission Belt Men's Ratchet Belt - Gun Metal - Gun Metal Buckle / Black Leather Strap, Medium (33 - 35)

reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect from such an inexpensive belt, but it turned out to be surprisingly well made.  The buckle is very stout and not at all flimsy, and grips the track on the back really well. I have never had it slip yet. I am loosing weight end trying to find a traditional belt that looked good an wasn't too loose or too tight has been challenging.  With this belt I can snug it up to just the right amought to be comfortable and keep my pants up. Something I have found hard in the past because I have no waist and a bit of an overhsning stomach still. I will be buying a couple more so I can vary my wardrobe. At this price, I can easily afford to. Cutting to length was the only place I was not real ccomfortable, but it was easily done with a heavy pair of scissors. The nice thing is, as I continue to lose weight,  I can continue to adjust the fit and length to accommodate my changes. I am a little over 225 right now and have not had any problem with the buckle pulling free as complained about by a couple of others. Just make sure the belt is inserted all the way to the stop, and completely close the clasp.
summary: Surprisingly well made. extremely good value for the money

Here's the deal: I have two other EazyBelts that I like a lot. But this one arrived with the plate on the front broken off the belt. It's cosmetic, but without it, the belt looks...well...exactly what it is - broken.
So my problem with this one is the buckle. A quick look inside the box before shipping would have revealed the broken belt, so it bugs me that it was even shipped out in that condition, (this did NOT happen in shipping - it's just a poorly constructed facade on the buckle).
Also, I didn't notice it when I ordered it, but this belt has no loop past the belt to corral the excess belt. That's no good. My other EazyBelts have one.
My advice: Buy an EazyBelt...but steer well clear of this particular buckle style. A poorly constructed front piece and the lack of a post-buckle loop makes this belt a poor value and poor fashion choice.

I really wanted this belt to work for me.  but it has some flaws that are worth noting as they were not apparent from the photographed item.

1. On the outside,  it looks ok  BUT  The buckle has a flat face riveted on to the buckle frame.  I thought it would be one piece and the back of the rivet scratches the belt a bit when inserted.

2. The ratchet system is not intuitive.  You would think that you would pull the lever to release the buckle, but instead, you have to push the lever in towards your groin area while you are pulling the buckle out.  The release lever is flush, but it is too flush for me.  When I want my belt to come off, I don't want to be slipping of the lever because there is really no good grip on it.  For best results, plan to use to hands with this mechanism.  not happy with release.

3. The metal piece that your belt attaches to on the back of the buckle is HUGE.  It is a big chunk of metal.  Again, you can't really tell from the pictures because it hides behind the leather, but believe me, its there.  and while you might think bigger is better, I had to use a screw driver to open the latch, which of course scratched the metal.  Not the best design.

4.  Belt leather is average.  It is better then my other easybelt, but thats not saying much.

In November 2014, I researched all the hole-less belts (slidebelt, missionbelt, trakline, easybelt...etc) and decided on Trakline based on the reviews. I was extremely happy with my purchase and decided that the Trakline was a high quality belt worth every penny (5-stars).
I wanted to get another belt just a few days ago and got this belt because it was less than half of the cost of the Trakline. Turned out to be a mistake.
Pros:
The leather belt part had higher quality leather than I expected.
Cons:
Belt head was heavy (2x more than the Trakline), and felt cheap
The function for taking out the leather belt needs to be redesigned so that it's easier to detach the belt head and leather. I had to get a tool to detach it.

If the creators of the belt make these improvements, I'd be tempted to buy the belt again as it is an attractive price point. However at the end of the day, better usability, functionality, and quality beats a cheaper price.

For now, buy the Trakline. You will not regret it.
Love it works perfectly. I'll never go back to my old belt again.
Great shirt

I read the reviews about others using it as an everyday belt. It's looks good, it's easy to use, and seems to be well made. Me personally, I can't wear it to work with all the bending over tubs and crates it constantly hit loose on me.

It was a great belt for 6 months.  Then the black center of the buckle broke off exposing the inner components.  The center of piece is only attached at 4 points of fairly weak metal about 3mm wide.  Once the inner parts were exposed, the spring mechanism came apart, locking the belt without a way to undo it short of a screen Driver.  Removing the belt ended up tearing the leather part all apart.

Contacted the seller and the were great and sent me a new buckle, though they did require me to send them a picture of it first.  I wish I'd thought to tell them that the leather part was damaged as well because it now looked like crap, but at least it still worked.

6 months later, the spring mechanism fell apart, again locking the belt in place.  I ripped it off and threw it in the trash.

Their customer service is good as they replaced the buckle free of charge, however I'd say the quality is simply subpar with regards to the buckle.

I bought a similar belt made by Vbiger and it seems to be a lot sturdier.  Hopefully this one lasts longer.
summary: Works great... for 6 months or so

This bra is made of a very nice soft comfortable material, but is very thin almost see through. (This isn't to much of a concern for me personally. I will explain later...)
This does run small, if you are larger breasted this probably is not the bra for you. I am a full C cup and measure 36 inches around, I had to stretch the bra in order for it to fit comfortably. After wearing a few times it has stretched enough naturally where I no longer have to place it over my arms and pull my arms outward before wearing.
As far as the material being see through, as stated above this was a personal concern of mine. Reason for this, this bra provides absolutely no support so therefor I would never wear this bra as a bra! I wear this as an undershirt, I work in a very professional environment that requires me to be dressed professionally at all times. There are a few clients who will get offended over just the slightest bit of cleavage, therefor this bra serves as a cover up for my lower cut shirts. It is thin enough not to be bothersome and doesn't add any extra bulkiness and is rather comfortable, more so then a standard tank top.
I am please with the purpose this bra serves for me, If you intend on using this for the same purpose I would recommend it. If purchasing for the sole purpose of a bra this is not the right bra!

This mask was perfect for its intended purpose as  you can see in the attached photo.  Our dog was having an identity crisis and feeling that she wanted to be more like the resident cats.  We encourage this form of self expression in all of our pets because like any good pet parents we want to see them grow up to be happy, healthy and contributing members of society.  Izzy was pleased with herself as she strutted around the neighborhood and no one recognized her.  She turned the heads of more than a few of the neighborhood kitties who came out to see who the new kitty on the block was.  So we're not sure if she's going to stay a cat but for now she is purrfectly content being incognito in her new feline skin.

The mask is incredibly well made.  I don't know what we were expecting for the twelve dollars we paid but personally I wasn't expecting anything quite this well made or quite this comfortable.  I don't think Izzy was either.  If she decided to stay a cat for a while I am pretty sure this mask will hold up.  Often when we purchase these inexpensive masks they are good for one or two costuming events before they fall apart.  I think this one will be around for a while.

BOTTOM LINE: If you know someone who wants to be a cat, or a madame or a dominatrix, I think you can't go wrong with this mask.  It is well made and really attractive.  What we particularly like is that the ear are stiff and won't lose their shape any time soon.
summary: Great mask for anyone who yearns to be a cat.  Quite well made for the money

reviewText:
As the other reviewer mentioned, the deep "V" in the front doesn't pull together anything like the picture presented.  My intent is to wear it around the house so I can live with that after I sew up part of the gap as well.
The reason for the 3 stars?  It says that the item runs small but I ordered this in XL to fit my top which is a 16 by US standards.  Below the waist I wear a 6-8 US. I would hate for someone to order this in a large size only to find out that the lower half of this dress doesn't match. The material is stretchy enough to be comfortable on top but I was hoping to have a looser fit on the lower have of this garment considering the difference in the size of my chest in comparison to my waist.  The fabric is stretchy but to my surprise it has about an inch to spare.  I thought it would be more roomy.
If you have a large chest and do not mind it being widely displayed then no alterations would be necessary.
I received this today and have yet to have it washed.  There are no tags to indicate any washing instructions.  After I do I will return to edit additional comments.
On a positive note the fabric is soft and comfortable.
summary: the deep "V" in the front doesn't pull together anything like the picture presented

I bought these as Prime and was very pleased that they came in time for a boating weekend, granted that I believe the brand is Chinese. Right out of the package I was so impressed with the quality. Like many other people, I didn't want to shell out for Triangl, and this piece comes through as a near perfect alternative. The colors are identical to those in the product image, and the mesh doesn't feel cheap at all (which honestly was what I was expecting). I ordered a small, and top fits like a dream (I'm 30D/32C), but the bottoms are SO small!! I'm 5'4" and 128 lbs, and the bottoms cut in and cause horrid muffin top. Keep in mind that neoprene does not stretch! I'll just have to buy a pair of basic black bottoms until I hit my target weight and hopefully these bottoms will finally fit. 4 stars for surprisingly great quality!!
summary: Surprisingly great quality, but be wary of sizing

I should note that I am quite tall at 5'11 and found that the sleeves were not too short and the length past the waist was perfect - THAT NEVER HAPPENS FOR US TALL GALS!

I, unfortunately, just could not get past the static cling this type of material creates. it made the shirt stick to me everywhere rather than keep that flowy look. There is a built in tank top "lining" for the front of the shirt and while appreciated so the shirt is not completely see through, I think that's what was causing such static issues. I would also like to note that I initiated my return and was immediately contacted by a customer service rep to see if there was something they could do for me.

Because of the accurate description of the sizing chart and the customer service, I would definitely love to order from this company again in the future.

reviewText: I like the quality of the leather, the hefty and style of the buckle, and the ability to make fine adjustments a LOT!  But the best feature of this type of belt (and the reason I may never buy a traditional belt again) is the fact that because there are no belt holes, there isn't a point of stress that can cause the belt to wear out and tear apart! The plastic track that allows the buckle to ratchet also spreads the pressure out. There's nothing to mar or stretch the leather. I can't overstate how much I appreciate that feature. The belt I purchased was cut to fit, and it was easy to cut it cleanly with an ordinary pair of sharp scissors.
summary: I like the quality of the leather

The mechanism is actually very easy to use but it's on the bottom of the buckle and not visible when it's on.  The instructions are pictures and don't do a very good job of showing the release lever.  The belt, as you might expect, is substantially heavier than an ordinary dress belt.

reviewText:
This is my first ratchet belt and I'm hooked!  I've worn this for a week and it's been working great.  I love being able to get just the right length around my waist because as we all know, we're not the same shape day to day or even hour to hour.  The ratchet works very well.  It's very easy to slide in.  I haven't had any problems with it slipping.  And it unhooks smoothly.

The belt was easy to cut to length.  With a flathead screw driver, it was easy to undo the belt.  Putting it back in was very simple also - just push the tab down.  The inside of the tab has teeth that will dig into the belt to secure it.  After wearing this 5 days a week for a couple of weeks, I haven't had any problems wth the belt coming off the buckle.

The belt itself is just okay style wise.  For the same price you can probably find a nicer looking belt with a normal buckle at any discount store.

I'm probably getting to get a few more belt and buckles to mix and match.  I don't now why I would ever go back to the "traditional" holed belt!
summary: Great ratchet system, okay looking belt

reviewText: Best belt I've ever bought. I don't have to worry about the holes or make holes when it come to losing weight and my waist line.

These are the best ratchet belts I have tried.  I recommend paying attention to the people who said don't cut it too short.  I did when I bought my third one and I had to buy another one.  But if you do that, save the buckle.  The belts seem to last longer than the buckle.
summary: These are the best ratchet belts I have tried

reviewText: I've owned this belt for 7 months now, and I literally wear it to work every day.  Great belt, great quality, still holding up amazing.  I absolutely love the ratcheting system.  I won't ever go back to a regular belt again.  I've also used this while carrying concealed, HOWEVER, I would recommend a thicker belt for that. You could carry with this belt, like I said I have, but a real good carry belt should be thicker.  Obviously that isn't this belts intention, just thought I'd throw that out there.

reviewText: First ratchet I've owned and I think I will never go back to a "normal" belt.

I like the design, and I like the concept of ratcheting belts. This one worked great, right up until the clasp broke about 10 minutes ago. It lasted exactly 11 months. I don't think I wear things over tight or am particularly rough on anything, although I usually wear a belt, so it did get regular use from me. It's tough for me to say what should be an acceptable life. A regular belt of course is mechanically very simple, so the leather tends to give out before the clasp, a process which takes years for me. This is the first time I've had a clasp break before the leather wore out, well the first time I think I've ever had a clasp break. I'll get another ratcheting belt I'm sure, although I will probably look around and see if any other options are considered more durable.
summary: Execution is great - not certain about the durability

reviewText:
This belt looks great and fits nicely.  What I found is that the buckle releases as I am working...and as a teacher in the front of the classroom, it can be "awkward".  I had a similar version of the belt and buckle that lasted and worked wonderfully for 3 years straight...loved it (once these things die...their DOA, thought about replacing the leather part but within a few weeks both the leather and the ratchet part of the buckle gave out...so make sure to order the entire belt and buckle - it's only a couple of dollar difference and not worth the hassle to have the buckle die right after buying a new leather).  I might try exchanging the belt and see if I just got a wonky buckle this time around.  Am likely to switch brands because the ratchet belt is much better overall than the traditional hole in model of belt.  If you get one with a good buckle I promise you will never go back to the old style of belt.

I am updating the review ...purchased belt in April inside of buckle (ratcheting locking part) broke in August.  Loved the belt (Leather part looks almost new after 4 months of daily wear) but have to replace. ..Will see if company can help me.

reviewText: I was searching for the perfect wedding shoes and I found them. I was very upset that they weren't delivered on time and had to wait over a month, but well worth the wait. I am usually a size 7 depending on the brand, but I stuck with my regular size and they fit perfect. They don't slip off, and they are beautiful. I wasn't expect the crystal to be so big but when I put them on me, both my mother and I were in awe....These shoes are definitively worth what I paid for. Reading other reviews I feel that if the crystal gets lose, I can always fix it. I walked in them for about 2 mins so i'm not 100% sure how long I can wear them but my gut tells me that I won't have a problem. I would suggest walking around the house just to break them in a little but I feel that with the height of the heel and the comfort, I won't have any problems. I cant wait to wear them on my wedding day and afterwards.
summary: I was searching for the perfect wedding shoes and I found them

If you have a "bikini body" then then is a great suit for you.  It is made of nice quality and feels like the more expensive suits I own.  The thing that really bothers me about the set is that the bottom really looks more like a size 6 than something marked XXL and with a top that does fit. I can get it on, but it is not something someone that fits into this size would be able to wear.  Each side is adjustable for size and or comfort.  There is also  a white bead on each piece before it is tied.  I believe my 10 year old would be able to wear the bottoms.  The top however is very close to the size they say it is.  I usually wear a 36 c/d or a 38 c and depending on the bra of course that changes sometimes.  The top clasps in the back and ties around your neck.  The clasp has three places you can hook it so it allows for some size variation.  I was planning on wearing it as a bra.  The strap that you tie around your neck has a nice accent of beads.  It is just enough to notice it and look good without taking over the look of the suit.  I think it would help hold the suit up a little but I would not count on it totally.  It did not break any of the stitches for me to pull on it to see if it would stretch out well.  You could also easily cut it off if you wanted to.  I do not see where the push up padding is removable but I do think you could cut it out if you needed a little more coverage.

I received this item free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: ... you have a "bikini body" then then is a great suit for you

I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  This in no way influenced my opinion on this shirt and would've left the exact same review if i had paid full price for it.

reviewText:
I bought this shirt for my boyfriend. He's 5'11", around 178 lbs, and has an athletic build. The L size fits him well. Since his chest measures 40 inches, I wavered between the M and L sizes, but ultimately decided on the latter after reading that some buyers found the shirt a little small. I'm glad I did, as the tummy room of the L shirt is just right for him.

That said, I wouldn't describe the fit as "slim." On my boyfriend, it was just right in some areas and baggy in others, especially in the back and arm areas (and we're talking about a guy with a muscular, stocky build). Regardless, the shirt itself is made with attention to detail and quality. Although the material feels a little stiff. I'm hoping a wash or two will soften it up. All in all, this shirt gets 4/5 stars from me. I would definitely buy from this seller again!

I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review.

i thought it was one you could tie yourself.
Good

This is a well-made t-shirt. The fabric is very comfortable and soft, and all the stitching is tight and even.  I could not find a single loose thread even after going over it carefully. That's impressive at this price point.

I'm especially impressed with the sleeves and neck -- great hem work that doesn't feel the slightest bit rough on my skin.  I also appreciate that it does not have a tag -- those are often a literal pain in the neck!

What's not so good is the fit. This runs very small. I normally take a large in a t-shirt for a comfortable fit. I got this in XL, but it's a bit on the tight side. I'd estimate that the XL is about halfway between a conventional medium and large.

Some of the tightness is inherent in the cut of the t-shirt. It's cut in a slim profile, plus the fabric has some spandex in it to keep it form-fitting. For me, it's a great t-shirt to wear under a regular shirt, but it's a bit too form-fitting to wear on its own.

If you get this you'll want to get at least one size larger than your normal size if you want a form-fitting look, and 2 sizes up from your normal size if you want a looser fit. Other than the sizing, zero complaints about this. It's made much better than I expected given the price point, and seems more than durable enough to last through quite a few washes.

Recommended, but with the sizing caveat.
[Sample provided for review]
summary: Excellent build quality; soft and comfortable; runs quite small

reviewText:
The S-Zone T-Shirt looks nice on, especially if you have a body in good shape. Its form hugging, so no matter what size you buy, the T Shirt was designed to cling to the body. It functions with a 95% cotton, 5% spandex mix of fibers, cotton giving you breathable fiber, and comfort, and spandex giving you the body cling. The cloth is nice and thick, so don't expect those gauzy cotton shirts made in Bangladesh. The length is good even for me, and I'm very long wasted.  I'd like to warn you about the size. Chinese sizes are always at least one size smaller than the US sizes. So an XXL is more like a XL that runs around a 46 inch chest. At least it was designed to be tight.
I was provided a free shirt in exchange for a fair and honest review.
Absolutely love it, gorgeous. Shipping was as expected.
summary: More beautiful than the computer was able to show

reviewText:
This bikini is really cute! It's the first swimsuit I've ever bought that actually looks good on me. I like the string criss-cross on the back and the tying strings on the bottoms. There's no padding in the top, which is perfect because tops with padding tend to move around and look lumpy after being washed.
The bottoms can be adjusted with the strings, but be careful when choosing a size because the top is a little tight in the back. I bought a medium and the bottoms were fine, but the top was tight in the back because I have wide shoulders, and lowly cut in the front only because my boobs don't fill up enough.
Overall, this is a great bikini!

reviewText: Love this belt. Looks good, works good.  Quality product I would say.

So for big dudes the tightness of a Belt changes when you sit down. Everything spreads. If you are someone whose job makes them sit for long periods, it can get uncomfortable. And it's a hassle to lift and unhook to find a more comfortable spot. And then when it's time for you to get up you have to reverse the process or your pants sag.
Not only do they have long belts but they are easy to adjust in seconds. Just lift the buckle for a split second and youve given yourself some breathing room. When it's time to stand just hold on to the buckle and pull the belt to tighten up.
To set up, You cut the length you want, fairly easy it can be done with Scissors. And you insert it into the buckle which inserts spikes into the leather.
This part is a little tricky because you have to press the spikes in really hard and requires good force. At the same time you have to hold the leather in place or it might get hooked on akward  when you want it completely staight.
I recomend doing a "practice run" on the first length before cutting it. And then use a flat screwdriver to reopen the latch (Wich it will need some force as well.)
At first I thought it wouldn't hold because of my size, but it's been doing a great job.
The belt is smaller than I thought but it works great and it's strong enough so no problem there.
When you put it on you just slide one end through the buckle as you pull it through and it clicks until you find your required fit.
The buckles are really cool looking too. There are many to choose from. However, They cannot be changed with other special buckles that aren't of the same kind because it is essential to the whole belt structure.
So far so good.

reviewText: Too small.

Bought this for my daughter's homecoming. We measured her and followed the Amazon standard sizing chart and the fit was spot-on! When you measure: 1) use a sewing measure tape, and 2) do NOT pull the tape snug; hold it as loosely in place as possible without falling. When measuring bust, measure right at the nipples. For waist, measure the smallest point of your waistline, typically right at or just above the bellybutton. For the hips, measure the largest point of your hips/derriere. The only thing I can say about those who had problems with fit is that they were likely cheating on measurements and are diluting themselves, which is understandable. Some larger people will call the measuring tape a liar because reality can hurt sometime. Know someone else with a larger build who bought a similar dress from the same maker. Loathed the measuring process, but took advantage of the custom fit service and contacted seller with her measurements. She was thrilled and the end product looked marvelous. Ladies, even if you don't want to face the music when it comes to size, a perfectly fitted dress will make you look stunning even if the scale tries to tell you otherwise.
summary: Perfect Fit and Looking Like a Princess!

reviewText:
The Good:
- Convenient to have on hand and easily accessible since it can be attached to your keychain.
- Durable construction. The cable seems to be sturdy and is short and tangle-free.
- No problems with incompatibility with any of my phones/tablets/laptops/computers.

The Not-So-Good:
- The design is flawed. The position of the micro-USB and the lightning cable plugs make it difficult to plug into phones/tablets that have a thicker case. You also have to stick the plug at an angle which is a little odd.
- The keychain concept, although neat and convenient, may result in a shorter lifespan of the product due to heavy metal keys always hitting it.

I received this product for testing purposes in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Convenient key-chain cable compatible with Apple and Androids

Altough it's considered highwaisted, the skirt is a little short for my comfort, especially if you're wearing it highwaisted. I'm 5'5, and I had to keep pulling it down so it wouldn't show anything. You could wear a long cardigan or flannel over to make up for the length, but it's still a risk. I ordered a red skirt and a black one. The black feels a bit shorter than the red, and the red shows the texture a little more than the black. The waistband seems to be a stretchy band wrapped in the fabric, so you may have trouble fixing it if it twists around while washing or during use. It shouldn't be a huge issue though, just a little inconvenience. Other than that, they're a nice style, stretchy material, good texture, and the colors are vibrant.

reviewText:
This is really nice looking flared skater skirt. The hems are straight and there are no loose threads. The elastic in the waist is smaller than the waist band which makes the band to fold and not stay flat. I am 5'1" and about 140 pounds and it fits nicely. But I do find it to be a little to short for me. I which it was a little bit longer. But it does look really nice with stockings. The texture of the skirt is nice and the fabric feel nice against the skin.

****FTC - I received a discount for this product in exchanged for my honest and unbiased review. Compensation of any kind is never accepted in exchange for a positive review. All opinions expressed are my own based on my experience with the product and not edited by any companies mentioned. This is just my opinion, your experience with this product might be different. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission guidelines concerning the use of endorsements and testimonials in advertising. If my review was helpful to you, please let me know your thoughts.
summary: A little to short for me

reviewText:
I'll start this by saying that I'm 5'3" and a size 4, not the skinniest, but certainly should be well within a free size item. This is only for those who are a size 2, or maybe a 4 with 10% bodyfat. Kind of ridiculous for something free-sized in my opinion. I'm also not tall, but if I were to wear this as a high waisted skirt I would get arrested. I actually prefer short skirts, but this comically short. I asked my husband how it was in case I was being too critical, and all he could say was "Wow. Cheeky!"

If that were the only issue, it would probably give it 3 stars, but the stitching is horrible! After ten minutes of wearing it, around the house of course, a large part of the hem fell out. This was 10 minutes of not really doing anything except sitting on my couch doing homework. Not exactly strenuous or tough on fabrics.

So, basically, if you want to purchase this for a child or preteen for dress up, this would be okay. If you actually want to wear this as a skirt, look elsewhere.

I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review
summary: Too short, too small, too poor of quality.

reviewText: This skirt is very pretty! The fabric is really nice. Hems are straight and there were no loose threads or anything like that. I'm really disappointed that it is too small for me. Unfortunately, I couldn't even get it on to try it so the fit is totally not there for me. It is too short and too small in the waist. The fabric and waistband does stretch but not enough for me. I am 5'7" and 160 pounds. I think this skirt would be really pretty with stockings and booties but you will need to be much smaller than me to fit it! I received my item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. My intention is to inform buyers of the quality and functions of products so that they can make better informed buying decisions. My opinions and thoughts are 100% mine and have not been swayed in any way.
summary: This skirt is very pretty! The fabric is really nice

reviewText: Great value, fit well, lot's of design options. This one is more red/burgundy than the picture looks (at least on my computer). Still my daughter loved it.

I'm please with this skirt. very pleased. the color is exactly as shown and the design is the exact same. it is on the heavier side, so I'm looking forward to wearing this in fall. I am 5'5 with a waist of 30 inches and it fits snugly... coming about 2 inches above my knee in the front and 2 1/2 on the sides. not exactly a high wasted for me, I wear it normally on my hips. this skirt is exactly what I've been looking for. the only major thing was a few loose strands! it's great! great quality; it will last me a while. not to mention the hems/seams are perfect. exact color I wanted too. extremely pleased.

So, before I ordered this, I read all the reviews. And I mean all of them. I looked at the measurements, and even measured myself just to be sure it would be fine. It is 'one size fits all' after all. I looked at the pictures others have uploaded, I considered that it is coming from China so it might run small, but, like I said, the measurements made it seem like it would fit.

It came a month early, estimated arrival being a month and a half after ordering. So that was nice. And I ordered wine red, which isn't exactly the same as the picture but still pretty nice. Those are the only good things. It is super, super small. And short. And it is a mini skirt, so I did expect short but. This doesn't even cover my butt and in the front was only an inch lower than my crotch. I'm a 4-6 pant size, about average. I tried just having it at my hips instead of my waist and. Mother of muffin tops. Seriously. I've never worn anything that looks worse on me. And the material is really weird. Like... Grandma's curtains/tablecloth type material. Some kind of pattern. It's soft, but I hate how it feels. The inside is a typical silky cotton that's inside most casual skirts. No loose strings and the hem is even though. The waistband does stretch, but the elastic isn't attached and twists as you're pulling it up.

So. Really disappointing. Maybe it'll fit my ten year old little sister though. Overall, I wouldn't buy this unless you're really, really skinny. Or unless you're buying it for a child.

I like the color and material of these shorts, but I'm undecided about the style. I ordered them to go under a mint tutu for an outfit I was modeling at a photoshoot. I purchased the large because according to the size chart, that's the size I needed. When they arrived, I was actually quite surprised by how comfortable the material is, however, they are a lot longer than I thought they were going to me. First, they fit great. Not loose, not too tight, but when I button them up, they go above my belly button and the legs are much longer. They look shorter on the model. I needed a short pair for under the tutu as it was just supposed to be a way to hide my underwear from the sheerness of the tulle and the tutu was quite short so we didn't want anything that would be longer than the tutu. These shorts met mid thigh for me. I have other shorts in the exact same size and they were no where near this big or long. Nothing a few alterations can't fix. We just rolled the legs up a bit and the waist rolled down. It's just weird how they fit me. Nothing wrong with the shorts themselves, I don't think. It's just that all bodies are made differently and they just personally fit me in a weird way. We still got them to work for what we wanted them for, though, so I'm happy.
summary: I like the color and material of these shorts

reviewText:
I am now a Coolibar collector.

These are like most of their product, are very nicely Made in China from natural materials - bamboo charcoal and rubber, converted to viscose and spandex blended into a fabulously comfortable fabric.

This technically advanced synthetic fabric is made from renewable resources.

The ZnO sunblock is a great feature, but slows down the drying time of these, needing almost as much time as a cotton towel. Worth it!

reviewText:
Great for runs on the beach.  I'm 5'5" 150lb with a good sized butt, so I struggle sometimes with looser short shorts.  This one shapes in the back instead of being the same as the front allowing my tush to be fully covered during my run.  I wore these shorts during a(n outdoor) yoga class though (I was doing yoga before running, so I didn't think about it...) and its safe to say these shorts are a bit revealing in that situation.  Luckily I was wearing cuter undies.  You may want to shy away from using these in lifting or on leg day too, just because they are a tad baggy and stay best when worn in the standing/walking/running position.  Or I'd wear some boy short undies for piece of mind.

It's definitely in an Asian size, and I noticed the measurements in the description (at the time of purchase) are a few centimeters too generous compared to the actual measurements of the coat I received. I came across several different listings of the same coat (I presume, from product photos) and found the product description from this listing much more accurate (MEXI Women's Double-breasted Cashmere Hooded WoolenClassic Pea Coat Jacket) at the time of this review. Since I had read several different measurements of the same (again, I presume, from the listed product photos) coat from different sellers, I chose a slightly larger size than needed. The Medium size (actual measurements of my coat - Shoulder: 40cm; Length: 80cm; Chest: 94cm; Sleeve: 59cm) fits a U.S. size "Small/Petite Small" person fine. The material is a thick wool with good weight. The color gray is just as pictured, and it was nice to find all the details including the hood, pockets, lining and stitching are of quality. From my own personal purchasing experiences, it is sometimes hard to find this level of quality when dealing with countries with an unknown quality control standard. I'm not fond of the lightweight plastic buttons, but they can be easily replaced when the time comes. Overall, this was a pleasent experience, with the exception of the error in measurements.
summary: Good Quality Coat, Listed Measurements Inaccurate

In bare feet, the hemline hits the floor, in heels (yes, she wears them) there is enough clearance from the floor where she can walk easily without tripping.  The top portion is tight, which is required when your bra size is a D cup.  But it holds everything securely.  The only weird-ish thing for me (the mother) is that there are two small sequin circles directly over the breasts.  It is part of the design of the dress but look a bit odd for me.  Doesn't bother my daughter.  All in all a wonderful purchase for a formal occasion.

reviewText: Wife loves it

This material has good, firm resilience and after a dozen or so 5k walks in my partially retreaded Birkenstocks, it shows no discernable wear. Unlike the softer stock Birkenstock crepe sole material, this stuff is very resistant to picking up pieces of sharp road gravel and other sharp debris. The firmness also takes a lot of stress off the cork body of the sandals and gives them a welcome firmness at the heel.

Just as importantly, this material is good to work with. You can grind it with a suitable (aggressive and sharp) grinder, and it's good to cut and trim as long as your knives or single edge razor blades (for fine, touch-up trimming) are really sharp because this material is tough. Contact cement bonds well to it without dissolving it. I'm very happy with it.

Love this skirt.  Very comfortable and versatile

Im beyond the age where trends have much impact on the contents of my closet. Most times clothing items that are trendy have such a short life-span that they have come and gone before Im even aware of them. Maxi skirts are the exception and are simply the most versatile wardrobe staple ever!

I love being able to pair a comfy maxi skirt with a tank top and sandals in the summer, or with boots and a turtle neck in the winter. Love that I can be deliciously comfortable and still look feminine.

As with a lot of super trendy things, finding a maxi skirt that fit well and that was well-made was a challenge. I knew that Poshsquare made high-end clothing so when I saw that they had a maxi skirt I couldn't wait to try it. I ordered the comfy chic maxi skirt in black, in a size large, at a promotional cost in exchange for an unbiased review and absolutely love it!

The skirt arrived, elegantly wrapped, and wore beautifully right out of the package. No ironing or anything was needed. The softly fitted waist is insanely comfortable with no binding or tugging. The soft fabric hugs my hips and bottom and drapes beautifully to ankle length (Im 54). I love that I can adjust the length just by adjusting how I wear the skirt at the waist  folded over and ruched at the waist and I can pair the skirt with low heels, sandals or flats. Folded over minimally and I can pair the skirt with heeled boots. Love the versatility.

Stitching is tight and even, seams and hem are finished well, and the fabric is soft and wrinkle-free. 5 gold stars for a gorgeous, versatile, wardrobe staple that is well-made!
summary: Trendy, easy-to-wear, versatile, and comfortable maxi-skirt. Fits and moves beautifully!

reviewText: Having never bought a maxi skirt before, I thought this might drag on the ground. I am 5'8" and this hits around ankles....perfect! I wanted to be able to wear cute booties or heels with this and be able to actually see the shoes, so the length is great.  Material very soft, too
The color was not what it looked like or what it said it would be.

It looks small but manages to hold everything I need.  I like that it stands upright. I don't love how the zipper works. I can't describe it but is annoying though not a deal breaker. Overall I'm happy with the purchase.

I'm so happy with this toiletry bag. It is well made and very well designed, and the design is SO pretty! Why should a toiletry bag be boring and utilitarian? I am glad that I looked around for something more attractive! In fact, even though I bought it for travel, I am using it at home as well because I like it so much, and because it's nice enough to leave out on my bathroom counter. This bag has lots of pockets inside for organizing your various toiletries, instead of just being a big empty space where everything is jumbled together. The pockets make it so easy to find whatever you need quickly. This bag can hold a LOT of stuff, too! When I do travel, I pack it quite full and it can hold whatever I need. There's a hook for hanging it if you rather do that. It's not the cheapest toiletry bag you can find out there, but I feel it was worth the price. And it's been my favorite so far, and I've tried a lot of them! .
summary: I'm so happy with this toiletry bag

I went by the suggestion to go a size up, so I chose one size bigger than what the product description suggested. Just to give an idea, I am usually a small/medium in tops (or a 6 in dresses) and the XXL fit me great. It's probably okay if you were to go with the exact size or a size up since the back is a corset tie and you can just loosen or tighten it to fit you. If you have a larger chest... definitely go up an extra size. Overall very cute swimsuit!! I am excited to wear this one out! I was fortunate to receive a discounted sample from the company so I could provide you all with this honest and unbiased review. If you have any questions or want me to get a ruler and get dimensions or anything, please do not hesitate to leave a comment. Thank you for reading!

reviewText: I got this product at a discounted price for an honest review. I ordered the same size as another suit, based on the size chart, and there is no way this is meant for anyone that is a woman's large. According to the tag it's a 2xl, which is a woman's large apparently in the U.S.,  I am a D cup and there is zero chance anyone larger than a B cup would be able to fit in this suit (unless you have perfectly rounded breasts) The body fits ok, a little difficult to figure out how to get the straps in back to fit ok without help, but even by myself I was able to get them to fit.
summary: Don't order unless you're a tiny chested woman!!!

reviewText: For reference I am 5 feet 5 inches tall and I weigh about 125 lbs. I got the swimsuit in a size large and it fits just right. There is no excess fabric, and it feels a little tight due to the elasticity of the fabric, but then again I think that's how swimsuits should be. You want it just tight enough so that there won't be excess drag when the entire suit gets wet. The fabric of the suit itself feels like a nice sturdy material. It has a bit of a funky smell when it came out of the bag, but it should go away with washing. The suit looks exactly like the pictures, the reds and blues are very distinct and bright against the white backdrop of the swimsuit. But I think the halter straps and the criss-crossing ribbon in the back could stand to be a bit longer. The halter straps are long enough to tie together, but not long enough for me to make a neater bow out of it, I can only manage a half bow with one loop. The criss-crossing ribbon for the back is long enough to just serve its purpose, but I think it would look more flattering with a tad bit more length, like how it does on the model. Also, the ribbon has a hole about an inch wide in it. It is not that the ribbon ripped, it's more like the seamstress forgot to sew up that part of the ribbon after they turned the fabric inside out. It's a problem easily remedied, but I'd rather not have to go to the trouble of fixing a clothing piece that should be brand new. Asides from that minor problem, the rest of the seams on the swimsuit all look neat and tidy. When putting on the suit, you really do want to loosen the back ribbon as much as possible before pulling on the suit so that you don't tear any seam by accident. The shape and cutting of the swimsuit is nice and structured, however, the breast cups are stiff. This is good for covering up the nipples, but due to the stiffness of it, the cups have a set shape that may or may not conform to the shape of your natural breasts, and this is before you put in the extra padding that they provide. Overall, I do enjoy the shape, material, and pattern of the swimsuit. I received this suit at a discounted price in exchange for an honest review.

I really like this bathing suit, it is just too small. Even what ordering based off the sizing recommendations, this suit was too small. It was tight trying to get it over my hips but I did manage it. Once I went to secure the top though, I realized there was no way the top would fit well. I am not an abnormally large chested woman, but there is no way this would fit anyone larger than a B cup. I will likely end up giving it to a slightly smaller family member.

The construction though, was very well done. It did not feel like the material was too thin, and I didn't notice any poor stitching. Overall it was very well made. The style was also very cute and should be flattering on many body styles. It was a little difficult to lace up the back properly on my own, but I managed to get it done.

Overall I am disappointed it didn't fit because it is a very cute bathing suit. I would recommend ordering a size up.

I was offered to purchase this product for a discount in exchange for my honest and accurate review.

I know I will be able to fit my phone and cosmetic and sundry items into it with no problem--better than being too small, which is what can happen, according to remarks I have read describing some other purses while shopping.  It has a nice quality chain, but does not include a shoulder chain.  A beautifully crafted, elegant, high quality purse at an excellent price.

The dress in the photo has a peach background. The dress I received has the same pattern of flowers, but on a white background. This is a bit disappointing. I purchased two of these dresses for my daughter who is a size 4.  I ordered her both the medium and the large because of other reviewers saying the dress ran small.  The large arrived and fit but the quality was very, very poor.  The lining in the back did not meet up at the zipper, the two sides had a 6 inch difference in coverage.  Additionally, the dress is so sheer that even with the lining you need to wear a slip, which would be hard to because lining in both the front and the back are cut in a very low sweetheart cut.  The dresses were also hemmed at the bottom preventing the dress from "poofing" as shown in the picture. The dress does not look like the picture at all. I would not recommend this dress.  The description and pictures on Amazon look beautiful but in reality the dress is not useable.  I have asked for a refund from the company.

Furthermore,the dress I  received was a cheap, navy blue dress that resembled the fabric of a cheap Walmart bed sheet. It looks NOTHING like the picture. It also was very wrinkly, and came in a small zip pouch. As soon as I opened the box, saw the dress, and inspected the hot mess that it was, I immediately put it back the the box that it was shipped in, printed out the return label, and shipped it back to wherever it came from. If I were you, I would skip out on this, there are way better dresses out there that go for cheap and that look so much better than this one. I guess my in store search begins for a purple dress that I can wear for the end of the month.

I got nothing but compliments on the dress! It fit perfectly -- I got a medium and I am 5'6 120lbs with a full 34c. I'd say that overall it's good quality, my only complaints were that it was hard to get all the wrinkles out (I took it to a dry cleaner then still had to steam and press it myself, but with a press cloth because you can't iron the material directly). Also the matching belt broke the night of the wedding so now I'll have to figure out something else to wear with it next time around since the belt loops are very obvious. I wish they had an option for replacement belts or a spare buckle.

reviewText: As a plus-sized woman, I do know to take "one size fits most" with several grains of salt. But when the description says fits up to a bust size of 52", I assume there will be enough fabric in the skirt to correspond to the max size. Not so, in this case. The bust did stretch to cover my bust, which is under the max size, but did not have any give or extra fabric in the skirt, and I was unable to get it even over my hips. I should have been  more skeptical, perhaps, but I did, after all, arrive at this item by using plus size as a specific search term. I will be more careful in future, but I would suggest that this not be linked to plus size searches, and that buyers take note that just because the bust has give, the waist/hips do not.

reviewText: Run small but material was nice and the color!

Beware of the Asian sizes.  If you are a small framed woman you can buy from the Asian market.  But a plus size woman need not buy.  An Asian plus size IS NOT the same as an American plus size. I ordered two swimsuits, size 2X.  The first one came and fit very well and then this one came and I was disapointed.  I was trying to figure out what the difference was.  An Asian 2X is like a size 12.  The customer service was very good and they sent me a 4X.  Still to small.  The 4X is like a size 14.  I wear an 18.  So in my opinion Asian plus sizes are not for American plus size women. Therefore, this is why I rated the product one star.
summary: An Asian 2X is like a size 12

What they don't tell you is that the size chart is Asian sizing which is way smaller. I'm 6'4" 275lb. I ordered a 2XL. The vest is a little small but I can work with it. The pants and long sleeve shirt are that of a chubby child size. The face mask barely fit around my neck and face. My feet hang over the shoes. The over all material is very nice though. If you're a small cosplayer than this is perfect for you.

To start off, the seller has great customer service and shipping was done from Friday to this Monday (shipped throughout the weekend too) Was very happy with speed of delivery. Although the costume isn't what I quite expected, it still lives up to its worth. Headband way too small and costume in general was 5-10cm too short. Also, the white pouch has no velcro strap to hang on my pants, just a belt attachment.

Overall, the presence of the accessories, quality of the costume and great seller makes this worth a 4 star product. Definitely would recommend you give yourself extra headroom based on your measurements!

The costume itself was made very well. However, if you're anything like me and sweat all the time and get hot easy, then this cosplay will suck for you. The shirt and pants both are thick almost like velour type of feel. No breathing at all. Hot, hot, and more hot.

Also the headband that comes with this makes it really hard to pull off the Angled headband covering the sharengun eye like Kakashi does. The headbands metal plate is kind of small too.

I ended up using a dark blue long sleeve t shirt and cut the pants to short like length, then used hemming tape . Once your legs are wrapped with the gauze,  you can't tell they're shorts anyways.

Also the vest that comes with this set is kind of floppy. The collar is not nice and thick padded like other vests I've seen for sale.
This cosplay was kind of high, looking back I wish I would've only bought the vest and shoes. The rest I could've gotten on my own and been more comfortable.

All in all when I had it all on with the wig it looked good, but could've looked better at half the cost

It's a great belt.  The leather is soft and pliable and doesn't feel like it will crack or split.  The buckle is well made and study with no flex or bending there.  Color from the picture is accurate.  Vbiger includes a steel punch so I can punch my own holes.  Apparently they're optimistic that I'll lose weight.  Thanks!

Update 7/26/2017

Belt has started to crack and is useless because it'll probably snap the next time I use it and I'm afraid of my pants falling in public.  Good while it lasted.  Buckle is  great.  Leather will crack.

reviewText: love it, will be order more for Christmas gifts

First of all: thank you!
I had a great experience with this item/seller.
Communication: Kinda fast, very kind and always trying to help
Items: Good material, the items are made specially for this cosplay, kinda impressive on how accurate it is on certain details
Shipping: Even when they take 2-3 days to ship, the time is pretty decent, and since they use DHL the shipping is very fast and secure
Size: I sent my measures to the seller so she could pick the best fit for me, everything went as planned, all the items fit me just fine!
Overall: If you are a kakashi/naruto fan, I recommend  you on buying from this seller, you won't regret it!

OMG The shipping was amazingly fast! The other reviews were right! I did though, got the expedited shipping because I am going to a Anime con in Dec 2-4th. I ordered this on November 11th and got it on November 17th, even though there was slight delay with my payment method. I notice on the picture that the zipper on the jacket looks white BUT its not! The Jacket and shirt is a little big even though I ordered a small. My measurements are (in inches) Waist 34-35, chest 34, bust 33-34, torso 28-29. Height 5 feet and 3 inches, a total of height 64 inches. You can Google or Bing converter to turn inches to cm. Also the shoes are too big for me but I can manage. Can't hardly tell unless I shake my foot or try to run, I have size 6 or 7 USA size feet anyways.
Needless to say, I admit I am a bit of a odd shape for my height and I didn't email the seller of my measurements.
The pockets you see on the front of the jacket? Fake. Just for show unlike in the anime where Kakashi keeps his scrolls in there. They are just nice puffy fake pockets with buckles on them. They do pull of the look of real pocket, then again I am being picky. However, I ADORE this cosplay. Nothing but a little rolling the shirt a little and tuck here and there can't fix. It does come with a white back pocket you can attach to a belt...Yeah, gotta find a belt to got with this.
 I will say it is warm, like a cozy hoodie, perfect for December Anime Con yet, I do hope the don't have the heat up too high inside the convention center.
Recap: Great and fast shipping, awesome quantity and quality, the large kunai can cut thin plastic and looks AWESOME. So glade it came before December 2nd. :)
summary: They are just nice puffy fake pockets with buckles on them

YES! Yes, yes, a million times yes! A quick disclaimer before I get into the review: I received this bag in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion. But I promise this is a completely truthful review: I LOVE this bag.

First off, I've never seen anything like it. It's absolutely adorable and petite without being too tiny. I fit all my things (which include excessive just-in-case products like lotions and hand sanitizer and tissues and more) in there with room to spare. I do wish the pockets were just a tad bigger, but I fit my mirror and headphones easily into one slip pocket, so I can't complain too much. It comes with two different straps: a short handle one and a longer crossbody. I put both on my bag because I just couldn't decide, and it still looks great! The hooks aren't unsightly and they're subtle and blend in well with the antique look of the metal. The black color looks faded and vintage, which I absolutely love. The straps are detachable so it can be used just as a large clutch on its own.

I LOVE this bag, I love it. It's so unique and cute and the absolute perfect size for me. I love its shape and size and appearance. I'd pay $ 50 for a bag like this, it's amazing. The detailing on the metal is precious and the straps are sturdy and thick, so comfortable enough to tote around all day. I've already gotten dozens of compliments at work from my coworkers, even those who hate purses. I think it's a great choice for anyone's personal style, whether it's girly or manly or grunge or anything in between. A wonderful bag.
Initial thought was a great purchase.  But, 5 days later the strap and clasp broke.  Not very good quality.

I loved this purse, but only had it a short time before it ripped at the top, the screws that hold the metal to the leather unscrewed themselves and the whole top of it almost came off, the only thing that kept it on was the two screws on the very ends of the metal clasper part....  So disappointed!!
