This purse is a lot larger than it looks! I was very impressed - especially for the price! It comes in several very pretty colors - and I may just order it another of those very pretty colors soon, too! It came VERY securely wrapped. It did take a little while to get here, (less than a month) but it did arrive well within the time constraints stated for delivery so I really can't complain about that. The color is exactly as it looks on my monitor and it comes with two very nice straps - one for hand carrying, which also would fit on your arm if you want to slide it back a little and one that adjusts for shoulder or cross body wearing. I have both attached because I like to switch if the option is available to me and another thing I love about it that while they are both on, the shorter strap lays back to one side of the purse so that if I have it on my shoulder, you don't see the second strap. It even comes with this little grey zippered wristlet purse type thing (shown) for maybe keys or change? There was no smell at all when I opened it up and it came wrapped in a lightweight dust bag. All in all, I am VERY happy with my purchase and I may well be back for more of the same.

reviewText:
Ok, maybe my title is a little ambitious, but I own 3 of these, so...maybe I am not exaggerating. I bought aqua, navy, and dusty pink.

The functionality, organization and ease of use is worth the price. Inside is a zipped compartment and 2 slip pockets. This bag also has a key keeper (until you've had a bag with a key keeper it may be hard to understand how this little strip makes it soooooo easy to locate and pull out your keys). Main compartment easily holds my iPad in a case, cosmetic bag, sunglasses and full sized wallet - I'm not kidding. Add to that the outside front zip pocket where I keep my i6 phone in Otter-box and you can probably understand why I bought 3. My younger sister, who owns many cross body bags was impressed with the capacity of this bag (ya shoulda bought this Dooney first, girl!)

I am 5'9 and the strap allows the bag to hang low hip. Its Dooney quality so even though its nylon it's good, heavyweight ballistic nylon. As with most every Dooney I own the zippers glide easily making 1 hand operation dependable. The interior lining is anchored to the body so its does not shift around; however it doesn't have feet and will not stand upright when empty.

The only drawback is that the lighter colored bags can pick up spots; however, that is easily taken care of (I have literally rubbed ink marks off Dooney leather using only my finger). I use a spot cleaner very cautiously.

You know, I really believe this is the Best crossbody ever If you appreciate these features then you will not be disappointed.
Love this! Great shade of purple - exactly as pictured. According to a friend, "You need to buy that top in every color." Very flattering.
Runs a bit large. But very cute!  And they don't cost an arm and a  leg.

Great bag..perfect size, great color..best cross body or regular bag..designed for either.  Love it.
Fit like a glove!

I am very much in love with this bag. Prior to ordering this bag I was using a combination of purses and diaper bags and backpacks to lug everything around with me on a daily basis. As a busy mom of two who is always on the go, I am constantly finding myself switching from bag to bag to find something that will hold everything that I need while providing comfort and style. Until I received this bag I had yet to find something that worked for me. This bag is a game changer for me. It's large size makes it perfect for storing not only my purse's contents but also important things that I need to have with me at all times for my young infant. In addition to my things and my son's things, I can toss a water bottle and an MP3 player in it for my almost 5-year-old daughter and still have extra room. The handles on this bag are very nice and strong and are comfortable to wear on your arm or up against your shoulder. Included with my bag was a long strap that can be attached so that you can wear your bag across your shoulder and chest. I choose to use the long strap because it helps keep the bag on my body without me having to constantly readjust it, and also because this is the most comfortable option for me. The leather used for this bag is obviously genuine and of very high quality. It's dark brown color combined with it's gorgeous style gives it a classy look that would look good on anyone with any style. The inside of the bag has pretty olive green material with a zippered pocket on one side. There is also a zipper on the top of the main compartment so that you can keep it closed to ensure the safety of your things. I have been using this bag daily since it arrived in the mail. I am extremely pleased with it and can not think of one single thing I would change about it. I will be sure to update my review if I do end up running into any issues with it. I would definitely not hesitate to recommend this bag to family and friends. Please note that I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. All opinions within this review are my own and I am in no way obligated to leave a positive review.

reviewText: I've been using this for over 1 year now. I was very skeptical of the $9 price tag, but I was trying different minimalist wallets out. The first thing I will say is that this thing is very durable and well-made. I don't know anything about leather, but this leather seems to have broken in very nicely. When I got the wallet, brown leather was an option, so I got that. The leather is now much darker and has a bit of a shine to it. Something interesting is that I kept a credit card in one of the front pockets and the leather broke in around the credit card number, so there's a permanent indent around the number and name. No, you cannot read the number. It's kind of cool. I have not had any issues with the wallet. It hasn't even begun to show signs of wear. I've scuffed the leather a few times and the scuffs eventually fade away. Somebody mentioned the cheap interior material, but again, I've had absolutely no problems. And if you are confused about the pockets, yes, the wallet has two pockets on both sides. I keep 4 cards in the outer pockets, and 3 in the middle. 7 total. Once it breaks in, its easier to get cards in and out quickly, and you can more easily fit more cards into it. If you're skeptical about the price, I would recommend at least trying it because it's so cheap. Unfortunately, I don't see an option for brown anymore, but it looks like the dark plum one is close enough, and may even be the same.
summary: Over 1 year of use - leather has broken in nicely

reviewText: Nice!

Love it! Stays on my ears, mine are small but it fits perfectly, second one I bought, and I just tighten the two thin metal prongs that go on either side of the ear all the way down just a little above the ear lobe, and very comfy.  Adds a new dimension when going out and wearing jewelry, I have the one that goes on my right ear, don't know whether that means anything but as a woman, I am loving its extra glitzy feminity, and my guy loves it.  I received my second one, but one of the tiny blue gems along the tip, fell out, now thats easy to replace with the appropriate glue, and it does happen with fashion jewelry but the trouble is that in this case, I cannot find where it bounded on the floor and heard it too, and looked for a couple hours.  The merchant needs to recognize this and as some businesses of this kind of low cost but lovely fashion jewelry, they add a small plastic bag with a few extra gemtones of the important areas such as the edge small blue ones, etc.  Ive purchased from companies that have done this.  Otherwise, I love this item, Im sure I will find that gemstone, hopefully, and if not alert the merchant later today.  Actually if they used Aleeen's 'Ok to wash It  glue that dries clear and is easy to use, with a tooth pick just enough glue will fix this if I find the tiny little gem.  However its a gorgeos different kind of jewelry and I love this one over all else I have seen and it stays put for me.  I recommend this and love it!

reviewText: This accessory looks just like how it does in the picture. The silver color is slightly more white in person, but it looks shinier than it does in the photo. The coins have very detailed images carved into them and are well placed on the chain. However, there were some negatives. This does make a lot of noise, even with the slightest foot movement, so I don't recommend wearing this to any area where you need to be quiet. Depending on the width of your ankle, your ankle may not be "fully covered", as in, there may not be enough charms to wrap around your whole ankle. If you do have small ankles, the charms will wrap fully around, but you'll have this awkward really long charm dangling...it's hard to explain but take my word for it. At least for me, this hasn't fallen off very easily and stays on for the whole day. Overall this is a very pretty accessory to have and will have people asking about it.

reviewText: Love it

Amazing Deal!

Like some others mentioned, they aren't a true black color but a nice, dark charcoal gray color.  They look really awesome too.  Wouldn't call them a skeleton though.  They look more like cyborg/robot legs.

Highly recommend, especially for this price!

Oh, and regarding size!  I'm 5-6 and wear (for comparison) Victoria's Secret size Medium for leggings.  So 28/29" waist, 38/40" hip, 22/24" thigh.

Don't purchase this item in "purple" if the color purple is truly what you want.  I am disappointed and rather angry because this item is not only plum rather than purple but the item in it's entirety is nothing like the photo.  Not only are the roses PLUM but the back ground is a dark dull gray rather than white or light grey as it's depicted on the product page. I can't even detect the stems on the roses that are suppose to be green.  There is a distinct difference between the colors plum and purple  that the average person can discern.  Thus, one would expect a company that manufactures and sells products in various colors to know that difference.  Therefore, to label this as purple is, to say the least, a  misrepresentation.  The curtain is also pretty thin so I'm not impressed with the manufacturing of the item either.  With shipping and handling, I paid $19.99 for mine.  I received it 16 days after placing the order. The company I received this item from was "Happy_Store Storefront"  and apparently is located outside of the USA so returning the product would be too costly.  Therefore, I have no choice but to keep it an give it away. Now I'll have to search again for a appealing purple shower curtain and hope that  it is indeed purple when it arrives.
summary: Don't Purchase this in Purple if You Really want "Purple" Roses!

My story starts not with the purchase of this shirt, but with a promise I made to myself many years ago. When I was sixteen, I vowed to never date a guy who wore animal shirts. I didn't think much of it at the time; it seemed totally reasonable to me. Truthfully, it was just another arbitrary characteristic on a long list of personal deal breakers for potential mates. along with crooked teeth, a lack of compassion, and an affinity for putting mushrooms on pizza. (Plus, I had just seen that episode of The Office where Michael and Dwight try to throw a party in their hotel room, and Dwight wears a shirt featuring coyotes howling at the moon.) But alas, life (or God - however you want to look at it) has a funny way of setting you on journeys you never dreamt you'd embark on. Indeed, I went back on my original promise and started dating a guy who owned not one, but two animal shirts (that I know of). I know, I know: I shouldn't have compromised my values for a guy! Boys are perpetual sources of disappointment! But you know what? When we were in high school together, I was a nerd and he was on the football team, so yeah, you better bet that I wasn't going to miss this opportunity for a dramatic turning of tables on high school stereotypes. Anyway, I digress. Long story short: I started dating this guy, I fell in love with him, I eventually discovered he owns animal shirts (specifically, unicorn and tiger shirts), and for better or for worse, I still love him despite the questionable wardrobe choices. I bought him this shirt on a whim, and let me tell you: it was worth it. The shirt itself is great; it's soft and fits true to size. There's no visible fading, either. The only complaint I have (though it's nobody's fault but my own) is that I can't find all thirteen ducks! At first I thought maybe the illustrator only put twelve ducks in the picture just for kicks and giggles, but I don't think anybody would be evil enough to do that. Though it was difficult at first, I've had to accept that maybe I just wasn't meant to find all the ducks. So, is it worth the price? Yeah, sure. Is it worth the crippling disappointment of not being able to find all thirteen ducks? Eventually I got over it. Will your animal-shirt-wearing boyfriend love it? Yes, yes he will. If this ever comes back in stock and you're on the fence about it - get it.
summary: life (or God - however you want to look at it) has a funny way of setting you on journeys you never dreamt ...

reviewText:
My daughter is really starting to get into wearing jewelry.  She does not care what kind it is.  She wants to wear it all.  I have started to look around to find her something that she could wear, but that I could wear as well.  She prefers my jewelry compared to something I buy just for her. She loves animals so this is perfect for a starter ring.

The fox ring is shiner in person than in the picture. I would not recommend buying this for an adult unless the adult has skinny fingers.  It is adjustable, but I was afraid I was going to break it if I pulled on it too much.  I think it will work out great for a little girl that is old enough to wear rings.  I purchased this to go in one of my daughters Easter eggs for her Easter egg hunt.  It is the perfect size for an Easter egg surprise.  I bought her lots of fox shirts to wear next fall so this will go perfectly with those!  I should add, that the ring is absolutely adorable.  The only finger I could wear the ring on was my pinky finger.

I received this product at a discount for my unbiased review.  All thoughts are my own.  I hope that my honest opinion was helpful. I only review products that I am interested in for myself and my family.

reviewText: Great item and good price.

These "half socks" turned out to be a bit too long (socks are 4.25 inches long) for some of my slide loafers, but the quality is exceptional. They stay in place and the fabric is just the right weight for year-round wear, and is smooth and stretchy enough to really stay put and remain comfortable all day. I've purchased many half socks because I have lots of "slide" style loafers and tennis shoes, and these truly do stay in place without shifting or working their way down, bunching up or sliding off your toes. They're perfect for my backless tennis shoes, but sadly, come up a bit too high on my instep to work with some of my more dressy slide loafers. I wear a women's size 8 shoe, so these socks may be the perfect length for those who wear a size 9 and up, or who wear them with clogs. Regardless of their length, I'll be buying more of these socks as the quality is vastly superior to any I've been able to find so far.

reviewText: Its a really nice jacket, the stitching on the back looks perfect

This jacket is really quite great. I was scared it wasn't going to be worth the price and I was just going to be buying an overpriced costume jacket, but thankfully it's actually a decent jacket. The material is actually quite nice on the outside, and soft on the inside (as others have pointed out in their reviews).  The embroidery on the back is really great too.

The sizing is definitely a toss up, but thankfully I was able to look down at the comments and the size guide in the description to pick the right size! DEFINITELY READ THE SIZE GUIDE IN THE DESCRIPTION. I normally wear a safe medium in US sizes (I'm around 5'8 and 135lbs), and thought I could have gotten away with one while reading the other reviews. After reading the size guide I realized I better play it safe and get a large, as I was willing to live with it if it was a little big. But it actually ended up fitting perfect. It might be a little short on the arms, but eh, I'll live.

There's only two things I can knit pick about. The first being the pockets, they aren't sewn down into the jacket so they kind of awkwardly stick out, but they can be easily sewn in, so I'll probably do that myself in the future. The second isn't really a downside, it's just a little precaution, which has to do with the embroidery in the back, it appears to be a little fragile, so I wouldn't go too crazy in the jacket.
summary: This jacket is really quite great. I was scared it wasn't going to be ...

Consider the price of this ring before you purchase.
Obviously this is a fashion ring made from cheap materials.
The seller should not be given "poor quality" ratings because individuals thought this was a "quality" product.

It is what it is explained to be.

The ring:
A deep bronze coloring.
Has rabbit features throughout top and bottom.
Is able to be size adjusted (slightly)!
It is not precious metal so it will turn your fingers green (to prevent this either apply two coats of UV Clear Gel Polish and Cure or apply a thin layer of "hot glue" from a glue gun.

Why I gave it 3 stars:
I did not like how it looked on.
It was very, very small and adjusting it to a larger size looked like I had sausage fingers.
I did not hate the ring, it just wasn't for me.

With that being said, I recommend this ring for anyone with smaller, very lady-like fingers, you will love it!
It is very cute, accurately represented, and has very detailed features, just not for me.

.

reviewText:
I bought this novelty type necklace because I thought it was pretty cute in the photos. I don't know. I guess I was feeling impulsive or something. When it arrived I was pretty disappointed.

The figurine was painted poorly. Either by a rickety machine or by a small child, it seems. It's just not well done. Not at all. I feel like if I wore it people would think it was something my kid made for me. It is basically made from the same materials as one of t those little green army men. That's about the same size too.

The best part of the whole necklace is the chain it came on. The chain is very nice and of a much better quality than the charm it comes with. It's weird, but that's how it is. I will likely just discard the little figurine and use the necklace to hood something else.

I don't exactly know what star rating to give it. I suppose it did have the character in the listing. It's the same weight and length it was supposed to be, so that's all the way it's supposed to be. I just want prepare for the "cheeziness" of the thing. I can't rate it highly if I'm going to be truthful.

I was fortunate enough to receive this item at somewhat of a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review of it. I always physically use and test out each product before posting my opinion. I am free to write whatever I believe to be true, whether it's positive or negative. This is my true and honest opinion of this item.

reviewText: I am 5'4'' 135lbs and size 36DD in bust size. Before ordering this romper I read all the reviews and saw that it runs a little small, so instead of ordering a Medium, I ordered a Large in Blue. When I received this product, the material was beautiful, loved the light weight, and the pattern for the material. However when I went to try it on it fits so strange. The romper is extremely short, like just barely hangs to the bottom of my butt cheeks, and if we are being honest, I don't have a very curvy butt.  Also if I bend over to pick up my purse or bag MORE than half my butt would show! The top of the romper is also a problem, it's extremely HUGE, when I'm wearing my bra. I can't go braless because that looks sloppy to me, but also with the top so big and floppy I would not have very much coverage, and there is no built in support. Also this is with the straps tightened/ shortened as much as they will go. I'm used to tops fitting me not having so much material that it exposes me. I am disappointed, judging from other peoples comments, and the pictures provided I definitely thought that this would be a winner. I guess I can still wear this product if I wear a tank top underneath, but then there is still the problem of it being so short that I would feel uncomfortable in it. So, another online purchase down the drain. Darn!
summary: The bottoms are too short, and the top is too big!

This skirt looks pretty in the photograph, but it's really not all it seems to be in person. I know the skirt is only 16.99, but the fabric looks much cheaper than I had expected it would when it arrived.
Now let's talk about the fit. I am by most standards pretty petite. 5' 5" and 110 lbs. I ordered the skirt in small and it was still tight. The "high waist" on the skirt is not much of a waist at all. If I pulled it up over my belly button, it just looked awkward like it didn't belong that way, and flared out ridiculously, making it look as if I had a huge pot belly. I found it to be an awkward length for my frame, too, although on some other body type it may work fine.
Lastly, I guess I did not expect the fabric to also be so synthetic feeling. It's exactly like wearing a tutu. It's feels like more of a costume piece than a skirt you'd wear out in the public. I just thought it would be, for lack of better terminology, more "cottony." Perhaps I didn't read the description carefully, so it could be my misunderstanding.
Whatever the case, this skirt is getting returned. It did not work for me.

reviewText: Only rated this a one star because you can't select "0".  Watches doesn't keep time even after setting and resetting. Long lead time between order and delivery.  Horrible, cheap, crappy watch! Don't waste your money!!!

I got this watch on the last day of november.

The body itself seems sturdy, but the inside decorations look pretty cheap. The same goes for the band, it started cracking pretty soon. My wrist has a circumference of 7 inches, the band fit well, with room to spare.

I noticed while trying to wind it that it didn't work like other watches where you leave the pin down to wind, and lift it to adjust the time. Instead, I lifted the pin to adjust the time and it also wound the mechanism. Turning the pin in the down position did make that faint clicking "winding sound" but ultimately did absolutely nothing. This seemed like a failure in the manufacturing process rather than intentional, but I'm not sure.

The hands are pretty difficult to distinguish from the background. It's ok to tell the time in daylight, but in a darker environment (or if you have poor eyesight) it's pretty much useless. It doesn't glow in the dark.

The body of the watch is a half inch thick, which is quite substantial, so be advised.

It kept time perfectly during the day, but it wouldn't keep running through the night unless I gave it a few good shakes before I put it away (to activate the winding mechanism that responds to movement). I didn't mind having to set it to the right time whenever I wore it though, but if this is a problem for you, again, be advised.

The band also started cracking pretty soon. I was actually considering getting a new band for it, but unfortunately the watch stopped working yesterday. I'm not sure what broke, but it won't even wind anymore. I didn't wear it every day, but I'd say I've worn it for about half of the time, so that would make it a month and a half (maybe two) of active usage.

Because of this, I would definitely advise against buying this as a present for someone. Unless you want to disappoint them.

In conclusion, you get what you pay for.
summary: Would have been an OK watch if it had held up for longer than 3 months.

reviewText:

They're fun and I don't think you have to have a "special" occasion or anything like that to enjoy them. I was given a discount in exchange for my honest review, but this is my true experience regardless. Normally I am a S/M in lingerie and a size 1-3 in pants, if that helps in determining fit! I ended up trading the large in for a medium because the former was too loose, especially at the waist.  I find this odd since most of my post-baby weight is distributed at my waist.  I'm not sure if the odd fit is due to my short torso.  The medium fits a little better, although I could probably still size down if it weren't for the cut in the back.  It rides up enough where it can be mistaken for a thong.  Another issue I have is that the left and right center bands at the waist are not symmetrical.

Usually I can find something good to say about a product, but I had to stretch with this one, and settle for 'it didn't arrive broken.'

Where to start...  Mint green?  Nope-  how about a spring green crossed with a bit of neon... that might be close.  Toss in some unintentional brown spots in the plastic as manufacturing defects-  small, but should have been pulled as defective pieces.  The metal between the links is smooth in the picture.  The left one of mine looks like the metal is rusting and was painted to cover it, all bubbly underneath.  The right side is scratched and it doesn't buff out with a soft cloth.  If I rub it anymore I'm pretty sure the gold tint will fade to silver.

It was cheap, and I didn't expect much, but I thought I'd see.  Maybe get a pleasant surprise to wear a few times.  Well, let me be the guinea pig on this one-  spend your money elsewhere. Mine is already in the trash, marked up to 'lesson learned.'
summary: Disappointing even with low expectations- and not mint green.

reviewText: Well made & comfortable.

What a beautiful, flowing, versatile summer dress!  Meaneor are a new name to me.  When I was asked to try out some of their clothes, I took some time to choose because, at first sight, their styles looked a little plain in the photos; but put a body inside and things change!

The fabric has a lot of stretch and reminds me of activewear.  It's a cotton blend with what feels like spandex, lycra or polyester.  I thought I would dislike it because I prefer natural fabrics, but after wearing it for a few hours, I found it very comfortable indeed.  Perhaps not the best thing for a really hot sunny day, but ideal for fresher summer days and the mid-season.  Also ideal to wear indoors where air conditioning sometimes goes too far.  The upside of the stretchy fabric is that it moulds very flatteringly and you don't have to worry too much about getting the size right.  I normally wear a US size 8.  I looked at the size chart's bust measurement and asked for a Medium (despite the fact that my bust is 34-35 and the M is supposed to fit 31 inches).  It feels like it fits me well.  A bigger size would be looser but these styles are made to be form-fitting, so I prefer to stay close to my normal size.

However, the best surprise was the length, it's actually perfect for me (I'm 5'8). Bravo, Meaneor, for getting it right!  There is nothing more disappointing that ordering a long dress to find that it misses those crucial few inches at the bottom.  At least, if something is too long, you can always take it up!  The elegant simplicity of this maxi dress evokes a Grecian tunic, and the distinctive rope tie gives it a slightly monastic feel.  Cleverly designed to adapt to a variety of shapes.  Someone with a short upper body (like me) can tie the cord tightly at the waist, creating a blousey effect to the top; if you have a more conventionally long upper body, you can tie the cord more loosely to sit wherever it falls naturally on your waistline.

My chosen colour, an elegant steel grey, makes it casual, although it can be dressed up a little. The racerback cut at the shoulders contributes to the perfectly moulding shape.  I wear a sports bra underneath, or one of those multi-position bras with straps that criss-cross at the back.  Despite the low price, finishing and stitching are good.  There was the odd loose thread but you can snip it off in a second.  The care tag is pretty standard:  Wash below 40C, hang to dry, low iron, no bleach.  It did wash well and does not need any ironing. I will be wearing this one a lot!
summary: Finally, a maxi dress that is long enough for me

A perfect dress! This is one to have in every single color! You will look and feel fabulous in this dress. It is a sophisticated and appropriate piece with a hint of sex appeal as it hugs your curves perfectly. It is not cheap spandex nor does it hug like a club dress. It lightly hugs curves without excessive tightness. It is great for work, a wedding, a party, church or when you just want to look nice as you go about your day.  It pairs great with strappy heels for a more casual effect or you can wear it with a solid stiletto and achieve a more polished look if for a special occasion.  The material is not see-though at all, rather it is a cotton blend that has a stretch and give.  Since it has a back zipper, it is easy to put on and to get off.

This dress will make heads turn as it makes you look fabulous instantaneously and hugs your curves perfectly!  Great for those who are heavy chested as it will extenuate your curves nicely, but not excessively!  An absolutely lovely piece. I got it in a small since I am a size 2/4. The dress fit as expected. I stand at 5'1", and the bottom of the dress hits just below the knee area making it perfectly appropriate for work, event or church.  I now own every color combination because finding a dress that slims you, I'm 125 with that bulging "mommy" tummy that won't leave no matter what I do, and makes you look polished is very difficult to find. This is an amazing dress! I highly recommend this for those who are very petite to plus size. It is the kind of dress that will look great on any shape.
summary: The Perfect Dress! Makes You Look Polished with a Hint of Sex Appeal! Extenuates Your Curves, Slims Your Waistline! Perfect!

This can include something as simple as someone handling the stones who is feeling particularly negative on the day these were put together. I ordered a size 8 based on reviews but probably could've gotten way with a 6. It is a little loose in places, specifically the bust and I'm a pretty busty lady (34DD). The back of the dress has elastic and stretches and would've fit my bust a bit better had I gone with the 6. The waist does tie but is also a little looser than I would've liked. When I think pin-up wiggle dress I think of something very form fitting. The only real issue I had that makes me glad I ordered the 8 was the zipper. I may have struggled to zip the 6, but I'm sure it could have been done. It gets stuck, especially around the waist ribbon, so I found it works best if you twist the dress so the zipper is on the front, zip it past the ribbon, then turn the dress back to normal and continue zipping. The fabric is fairly stiff cotton. Perhaps with a wash it'll soften up and shrink a little in the right places. All in all it IS a really cute dress and I do recommend it.

This bikini is super cute! I'm only slightly disappointed because I really expected the color to be a little deeper shade of blue? a little more vibrant for sure. But that's nothing some rit dye can't fix, the mesh part doesn't stretch at all and I think that may make the white material that is the mesh part appear a little more opaque (it may be tulle), again I'm sure if this is an issue fabric dye could remedy it. For the price I don't think these issues are a deal breaker at all the suit is still super cute and feels like a quality product. The solid part of the suit has some nice stretch to it, it's actually solid and covers what needs covering. The padding on the top is minimal and not removable but it seems to do it's job. I followed the chart provided by the seller and decided I might wear a L but not having too much experience with Asian sizes and after reading the other reviews I opted to order the XL. In american sizes I wear a 32D and usually opt for a large in swim tops for coverage, and wear a 4 in jeans usually purchasing a medium for swim bottoms, I found this top to feel a little snug just from lack of stretch in the mesh area I think but it appears to fit nicely, I find the bottoms just slightly too big but without experience purchasing similar items just because I don't find it super stretchy I think I would recommend ordering the larger size if your on the fence at least you'll know you can get into it then, I do find this to be a quality product and it's so inexpensive if alterations can't be self made, it may be worth it to have a seamstress fix any issues you have or just order 2 in different sizes, it may be handy to have a bigger or smaller size on hand for potential weight loss or gain. I totally recommend purchasing this product from this seller because the product is of nice quality and so much more affordable compared to similar items.

reviewText:
If possible, I would have given this 2.5 stars. I like the design, but the materials used kind of ruin the anklet. It did arrive quickly, though.

This is  a pretty anklet. The silver chain is a bright silver beaded chain - it is very dainty and seems it would be very easy to break or kink. From my experience, that type of chain is sturdier than it appears, but it could be problematic to have it on an anklet. There are eight little decorative balls on each of the two chains, and the chains are fused together at the ends. Of the eight seamless balls, four are smooth and four are stardust sparkle, and all are about 3-4 mm. The two chains have alternated designs - one is stardust, smooth, stardust, smooth, etc. The other is smooth, stardust, smooth, stardust, etc. They go well with the bright silver chain. The balls are kept in place with silver crimp beads. It's a good way to keep the balls in the middle of the chains, but definitely not very a very sturdy method to use on an ankle bracelet. In this case, the crimp beads appear clumsy and ruin the flow of the design.

All of that said, my biggest issue with this anklet is that it is WAY too small. It isn't even close to the stated length measurement of 25cm/9.84". Mine measures 21.1cm/8.3", 23cm/9" with the extension chain. At less than 2cm, I'm not real sure what is the point of the extension chain.

Bottom Line: A beautiful anklet that will go with anything. It is about 4cm/1.57" shorter than advertised. It would fit much better as a large bracelet - due to the chain used in the design, it will not take much punishment before breaking, and this type of beaded chain is a difficult fix. The crimp beads are clumsy and will likely break with little wear. I like the design of the anklet, however, I think the chain is too dainty to last as an anklet...especially when the overall length is 1.57" shorter than the seller states. (And I was being a little generous with my measurements.) I would not buy this again - which is too bad. Had it been made with materials that are a little sturdier - and the RIGHT SIZE - this could have been an amazing little anklet that I would have worn daily. Designed as it is, there is no way this will stand up to daily abuse.

The sunglasses in this style that I got before were good and reliable, even if they weren't that high-quality.

THESE sunglasses, which I had for only a week....

Well, I work in a family-owned retail store, and I often tell people about a certain brand of sunglasses, known as Oakley.  The person who became spokesperson for Oakley sunglasses was using his table saw one day, wearing his Oakleys, when the saw kicked back and hit him in the face.  The Oakleys were destroyed, and he had a scar in the middle of his cheek and his forehead, but his eye was fine.  His Oakley sunglasses saved his eye, and possibly his life.

So, with this in mind, let me tell you about these sunglasses.  I get them in the mail, and they're okay; they're what I wanted.  I mean, they were a bit inflexible when it came to folding up for travel, but what new pair of sunglasses isn't?  Of course, I have them for a week; I'm careful with them, making sure that they are left, unfolded, in a location in my room where they won't be scratched or damaged in any way.  Then, one Saturday I pick them up as I prepare to walk out the door to go somewhere, and I accidentally drop them.  They fall no more than two-and-a-half feet to three feet to my very, very padded carpet -- the same carpet that had enough padding to protect from damage my laptop, which I had dropped onto this carpet side first only a week previously -- and what do they do?  They break.  The cheap, plastic part of the frame that goes over your ears breaks right off.  Note: it doesn't FALL off.  It doesn't just pop out of place.  It BREAKS off.  What a piece of garbage.

I suppose I got what I paid for; if you buy it, you will too.  Bear that in mind when you see that price and consider it a worthy buy.  I would not recommend this product.

reviewText:
The purpose for getting this shirt is for my oldest son to wear at Scout meetings, Scout hikes and other Scout events.  He has pants that convert into shorts and now a matching long sleeve shirt that converts into a sort sleeve shirt.  I think it's a great looking, stylish shirt and my son likes it a lot.  He has worn it around the house and has found it to be very comfortable.  It's lightweight and perfect for warmer weather.  We're getting sub zero in Ohio right now so no hiking yet in it.

My son does wear a mens small to medium and this just fits him.  So, it does run small.  I would say to go one (maybe two) sizes bigger. This isn't the kind of material to shrink from my experience because his Scout pants are made somewhat the same.  The stitching seems very durable, I've tugged at the seams and you can't pull them apart like I've seen in cheaper made clothing.  I had my son do a lot of stretches and leaps to make sure it didn't tear easily and it didn't.  The buttons seems stitched on nicely.  The sleeves have a zipper to attach the arms.  Worked perfectly.  Easy to take on and off.  I found no issues at all with that area.  The zipper seems of good quality, doesn't pull apart when pulled on.

This is a good, versatile shirt that can be worn to both outside events as well as more formal events.  We love it and the only reason it got a four star is because runs small.  I did get this for free for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Perfect shirt for Scouting events.  Fits my son perfectly and is very comfortable.  Runs small though.  Go a bit bigger.

I'm one who reads reviews and really looks into how others like the product before I order anything online so I only see fit that I provide my thoughts to help out other shoppers as well. I love this dress. It it's very comfortable and light. Can be dressed up or down with the right accessories. From other reviews I ordered up a size as it runs a little small (ordered a large). I'm a medium (pregnant or not) 5'4 muscular build with a little "junk in the trunk" (25 weeks pregnant now), which the large appears it will fit until the end of my pregnancy in July. Although dress is stretchy which is great, don't be fooled. The dress is little thin so ordering up a size will help in the dress not being as see through especially as the dress stretches the further along you get. Common mistake is people order a size smaller to make them feel good... I get it, gaining weight stinks no matter what, but just because a garment stretches and you can get it on doesn't mean it fits. So know our correct size and order up one in this product. Also a nude maternity shaper would help for any maxi/body-con/curve fitting dress to smooth out any areas that you are a little uncomfortable with and also help give your belly a little support as well as minimize the appearance of the dress looking see through. Hope this helps and congrats mommas on your babies!
summary: Know your normal size & order up one & you'll love the dress

reviewText:
So I'm a 34 B cup,  but growing so most likely a C now. I bought a medium and wear it on the tightest setting and it feels fine.  It's a little weird to put on,  and when I have it on my skin under it feels very warm, I don't know if that's Normal because this is my first binder. It started out giving me the uniboob effect... But after some adjusting (surprisingly by placing my boobs straight forward instead of up and out) it actually seemed to work. It doesn't flatten me completely,  like I know it wouldn't but secretly hoped, but my boobs are very tissuey- just a gean I got from my mom. After trying on some shirts I found that some of them worked,  and some of them didn't.  It depended on the material and color and pattern really,  since I love my graphic tees. I just had hoped to be completely flat,  but I ordered other binders to compare, this one just came the fastest.  I don't know,  I appreciate that it gives me very flat A cups,  but it's not enough for me.

Tl;dr
Works,  just not as well as I hoped.

These shoes feel so good. I usually prefer a thong type sandal that I can quickly slide my feet in or out of the shoe. However, my doctor says to make sure I have an ankle strap so my toes don't try to grip as I walk.  I normally prefer a sandal with either a toe post or a toe loop to keep my feet from sliding through, but the heel cup and the three straps keep my foot securely in the foot bed.

I normally wear size 8 and have a somewhat wide foot; the 8 medium fits perfect. All four (4) straps adjust quickly with Velcro.  The orthotic foot beds feel so wonderful for feet recovering from peroneal and Achilles tendonitis (both feet) and a stress fracture (right foot). The Velcro straps allow me to quickly adjust the shoe when my feet swell after standing or waving on them.

They hold the shoe in place much more firmly than some of the other styles, which is a good thing.  They don't move around when they are on your foot.

reviewText:
At face value this is at best a 3 star dress.its a cute design but for the price it was expected that the fabric was not the best quality. Given that I have a big butt but I would think the size would have compensated . Strangely enough the lace part hit at a good spot. I also noticed that I got two hooks instead of a hook and eye to keep the top back of the dress closed.
I probably could have overlooked all those things if it wasn't for the fact that the dress was CLEARLY already worn. Make up stains along the entire top of cups, the outer front had a bit as well. The straps were warped in the sliding adjuster and dirty on the inside. Even the armpits were dirty. Worst of all it SMELLED Like old stale perfume and body odour.  As women we know, you don't 'try on' a white dress with a full face of makeup. This dress is more to be stepped in anyhow. It's pretty much impossible to stain a dress like that just by trying it on for a bit. So it is clearly USED.
I expected a cheapish outfit which would be fine for the intended beach side event. I even thought there was a good chance it would not fit. I did not expect to get USED clothing. #amazonfail

reviewText:
This bundle of Womens 4 Pcs Set Handbags (Black) purchased from Amazon. When this bags arrived it has a set of Tote bag,Cross-body Bag, Wallet and a Key holder. I like the style of this bag its pretty simple but nice looking. They have a lightweight kind of material and made of PU leather. The Tote bag/hand bag you can wear it by your arm or on your shoulder,it has sling that you can attached to its side. The Tote bag also has 4 gold metal studs at the bottom to prevent and avoid get some scratch. The cross-body bag has a cute gold chain and I really like it. Both of this bags inside of it there's a three pocket ( 1 zipper pocket, 2 open pocket) and one pocket zipper outside. When you open the wallet it has two open side and one zipper compartment. The key holder it has gold chain that will hold six keys. It will locked with four gold button on it. All the zipper of this bags went smooth. The stitches also is clean and the handle of the shoulder bag strong enough to hold some stuff. As I used this  bag for me so far so good, I like it. This bag you can use it in daily basis or some occasion. I like also the black/gold combination. The size of this bag for me its perfect. Over all I really like it.
I disclose that this product I got for discounted price in exchange for my unbiased review. All thoughts and opinion based on my own experienced.

reviewText:
The problem with this ring set is that they don't list the commonly understood (at least in US) sizes, i.e. 5, 6, etc. anywhere. Without the aid of a conversion chart, millimeters don't tell me anything about whether or not the rings will fit my finger. I just hoped that they would be somewhere between standard sizes 5 through 8. The rings themselves are really lovely and I was looking forward to wearing all of them, but two are approx. size 8 and 8 1/2, respectively, and the other two are between 3 1/2 and maybe 4. Which means that only 2 of these rings are going to be useful to one person, because I can't imagine anyone with fingers ranging from 3 1/2 to 8 1/2! I can only wear the second largest and will have to re-size the largest (the nicest one with the elephant), which doesn't even fit my thumb. The smallest is so small it doesn't even fit my pinky, and I have very thin fingers.

That said, I emailed customer service to share my frustration and received an immediate and much-appreciated response. In this day and age, unfortunately, one rarely receives satisfaction from any customer service dept., so I was pleasantly surprised to find that they were apologetic and seemed to understand the issue. They even refunded my money, which I hadn't asked for! They agreed to, in future, post US sizes in the description, so I suppose time will tell, but based on my customer service experience I would purchase from them again.
Too small and didn't really look well constructed.
summary: Save money for a more expensive set.

reviewText: Thank you for selling something like actually looks like the photos. My fingers have always been bigger than I'd like but I arranged the rings to work with that. For the price, I am very satisfied with them. I don't plan to wear them everyday so they should last a good while. Love them, thanks again.

I really like most of these rings.  The ring with the elephant is my favorite and I wear it every day.  Despite being quite large, it's very comfortable, due to the narrowed underside of the band.  The thick band with the carvings is very uncomfortable, due to it's thickness all around the band.  The small flat band with the leaves is nice, too.  The other small ring is not great, because it's so wide. And the metal, I don't what kind it is, but it doesn't turn or make your fingers green.  So, 2 out of 4 of these rings are great, and with the price being so low, it's worth it for the elephant ring alone.

These are pretty awesome. I read some comments that these panties didn't glow, but I found that they just need to have ample "charge". If they are hidden under your clothes all day, they don't light up when they are bared to the night. I left mine in front of a light while out and slipped them on right before bed and had no issues. They are a hipster fit and have full coverage in the rear. I think I would have liked them to sit a bit more high on the cheek so my butt looks better. Let's face it, if you wear these - you want to show them off! My husband loves them.

So soft!  Adorable on our son.  One of my favorite gowns to dress him in.  The bottom part snaps/unsnaps to keep his feet warm.

I had purchased one of these baby gowns and it was so super soft and well made that I decided to purchase another, even before our son was born.  Somehow I wound up buying not one, but 3 identical gowns.  I decided to keep all 3 since I wanted more anyhow, and I didn't figure a newborn was overly concerned with whether or not he was wearing the "same" outfit repeatedly.  Given that he was just born a few days ago I have only worn them on him a couple times, and of course they have only been washed once or twice, so I can't really speak to their durability - although they feel extraordinarily well made.  I absolutely love everything about them: the softness of the fabric, the mittens which can be folded over if needed, the bottom of the gown which can be closed or left open, and the fit of the gown.  My little guy is very little - he was only 5# 14oz at birth and came home at 5# 9oz, so we don't have many things which actually fit.  These gowns are cut in a way that allows him to wear them better than any of the others I have, as they are more slim fitting.  They are still crazy long in the arms, but I figure he will start filling them out soon.  That being said, these gowns have a good deal of stretch, so I expect they will fit for quite a while, and the 'slimness' shouldn't be an issue when he does have a little more substance.  I fully intend to buy a few more, including some 3-6 month ones.
I would highly recommend these gowns as an absolute must have for anyone expecting a baby!!

I bought this because my baby doesn't love being swaddled and I love the halo sleep sack but wanted something really easy to put him in for sleep. I got the 0-3 month size and he's almost 8lbs and it fits really nice with room to grow. I will definitely be buying another one.

reviewText: Not as warm as I thought it would be.

Before I try a product, or ever order it for that matter, I like to look at the reviews on Amazon to see what people like and dislike. I noticed everyone mentioned that these run small. That is because the sizing is Asian. If you pick just the number that is an Asian size. If you pick the one that says Asian #/US # than the US size number is accurate. I wear a size 31 waist and I ordered a size Asian 34/US 33. The waist did indeed fit like a 33 waist. The rest of the pant fit perfectly. The extra waist is not a bid deal as I can use a belt, but if I could do it over I would order the next size down.

Another reviewer complained that the pants fade after the first time washing. I took a picture before and after washing and drying the pants and I did not notice any fading. I am sure they will fade over time as the colors are very dark and vivid, but all my clothes fade with time. The pants feel great. I love the inner fleece liner. They appear to be well made. These are great for cold conditions. I wish the outer material was not cotton as these would make great snow pants. I have not tried these in snow as I live in Texas, but plan on it eventually. These pants have several pockets.

I am not an Amazon or company affiliate. I am an Amazon Prime customer who writes reviews as a hobby. I received this product as a promotion. If my review has helped you, please thumbs up so I can continue to provide helpful information for your purchasing. If there are any questions or comments, please comment or message and I will be glad to help!

I live on a farm that has quite a bit of woodlands on it.  I will often go out in the woods to get firewood, hike, or hunt.  So fleece-lined camo pants seemed like a good idea.  These pants came and I have to admit that I was underwhelmed.  I saw some other folks were having issues with sizing so I ordered a size larger than I usually get.  The length is right, the waist is right but the legs are tight.  Sort of form fitted.  Not so great for moving around.  The outer material seems like typical camo pants. Although I noticed there were loose threads all over the place.  The fleece liner reminds me of the inside of a sweatshirt.  As far as keeping my legs warm, they did a fine job.  It hasn't been terribly cold but cold enough and these pants worked just fine for walking in the woods.  I just wish the fit were a little looser in the legs because it felt like they restricted my movement.  The pockets had stitches through the opening to keep them closed.  They were easy enough to break open but it seemed like the pants would be easy to rip a stitch on.  These pants are nothing special but if you don't have a special need, they just might work (assuming you have skinny legs).  I'm not sure I would buy another pair.  I received this product for free or discount in exchange for my honest review. Thanks for reading.
summary: I ordered a size bigger than usual and the legs were still tight

reviewText:
I love these pants, but the sizing is very awkward.

Sizing: If you wear a size 36 in jeans, you'll need to order at least a size 38 in these pants. I say at least, because while the waist size difference is 2", these pants are cut for someone who has not butt and skinny thighs. I wear a size 37 in jeans, and the size 40 in these pants fits me very well. The seat of the pants is still fairly tight, but I can't really blame the pants.

Comfort: These are very comfortable pants. The fleece lining is soft and very warm, even when I went out in the snow below freezing.

Durability: So far, I haven't seen any issues with the seams coming undone or tearing of the fabric. The outer fabric looks to be very durable and has not had issues with me tossing about outside.

Style: The pattern is pretty far out there, but that's to be expected with ski pants. No issues from me here.

Verdict: Overall, excellent pants. These are my new go-to casual pants for snowy weather.
summary: I love these pants, but the sizing is very awkward

reviewText: They are nice and warm and somewhat large. I like them still though.

This is my review for Roludom Men's Woodland Wintet Fleece Lined Camouflage Cargo Pant, 40 Yellow Camo. I bought these pants for my husband, who likes to wear this kind of stuff working outside and tramping through the woods. He has worn them a few times now, and tells me that they are holding up pretty well. First the negative. These pants are snug. After reading other reviews, I decided to buy a size larger. Good thing I did. At a full size larger than the rest of his pants, these pants are just barely wearable. He would have preferred an additional size up. Because they are so tight, he doesn't feel that he has the range of motion that he has in his other similar pants. To the positive, the lining is comfortable, the heavy cotton does a pretty good job at keeping dry, but it is cotton and will have its limits. Heavy weight material has done a fair job of fending off the briars when walking off the blazed trail. All in all, he says that they are pretty good, but won't be his first choice, partly because of the sizing and mostly because he prefers his other options, which offer greater range of motion. I was fortunate to receive this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion. I always pre-test every product prior to writing a review. I am free to write whatever I believe to be true, whether negative or positive.

reviewText: Love them! No complaints!

It holds a lot.  It is sturdy and I love that I can tuck it inside itself and zip it shut.  I got it for work (I work at a school and ti carries everything I need.  The only problem is it that is's black and my small purse I carry inside is black, so I solved it by buying another and saving the black one for weekends.  I would recommend it to anyone.

I'm surprisingly impressed with this backpack. At first I was confused because I thought that it would come with a pouch to put it in but after a minute I realized that the zipper pouch inside the big part of the backpack actually folds inside out and you stuff the backpack in it! I will say that a basic photo showing this would have been nice but I put a video together showing how to do this in case anyone else is a little confused when it arrives like I was. When this is all folded and in the pouch it is approximately 7"x7" which is not big at all and it is very light. The backpack itself is made of an easily cleanable (what feels like) waterproof material. The zippers and straps seem well stitched. The pouches and the straps are a padded mesh material and the pockets on the sides have elastic on the top so your stuff doesn't fall out. I can see us using this in our camper so that we have a backpack for hiking trips or day trips but where I could see it being most valuable is if you were going to an amusement park. More specifically if you were flying to a certain park in south-eastern USA where a certain mouse lives. Trust me; you don't want to go there without a backpack and this is the perfect size one for something like that. My son thinks this is his so I'll let him think that for a while but this is way too cool of a pack to give to a 3 year old. :-) I received this complimentary product for my honest and unbiased review but that in no way swayed the above statements.
summary: What a cool concept for a backpack, folds up to a 7"x7" package with a wrist strap!

reviewText: I have had these for over a month now. Someone asked me thru Amazon Answers if these offered total UV protection. My wife worked in the eye glass business for 30+ years and is now retired. Without doing a specific test at someplace that has the equipment, she says that she couldn't tell for sure if they have total UV protection. She did say however that since they are not advertising that they do, plus with the 'dot' side frames (which obviously don't protect you from UV), her opinion is she would think they probably do not. I have had cataract surgery with my lens replaced in my eyes so UV is no longer a concern for me. I do like the glasses a lot. Not so much for driving around in town though due to the side shields, which do not go on and come off easily w/o a very small Philips screwdriver. The fact that they do not claim UV protection and the risk of taking away some peripheral vision lowered these to 4 stars. Safety aside, they do look good on me though and the finish has held up well so far. They are the blingy-ish pair I own!
summary: A review inspired by an Amazon Answers question.....

I was surprised that it fit me so well, because I generally wear a size 0 or 1, and I ordered a 2, so be prepared for it to be a little small around the waist and chest. The skirt is beautiful, full, and flowy- I feel like I could fall flat on my face in this dress and still look graceful. All in all, it is an amazing dress for an amazing price, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
summary: This dress is absolutely beautiful. It looks exactly like the picture

reviewText: This is a gorgeous dress and it was every thing we expected and more. Great price as well. Fit perfect

INFORMATION:
I'm 5'2" 32A 112 lbs

FIT:
-Because I'm 32A, this dress doesn't fit me well. The chest area is meant for b cups or higher. So it's extremely loose on me. I can wiggle in it and the straps will fall off!
-I tried on a push-up bra and it looked nice but then the bra shows on the back since the back of the dress is really low.
-The only thing that's keep this dress on me is the waist. It fits really well and it wraps around my waist nicely.

QUALITY:
This dress' quality is so amazing. You can't beat the price. So worth it! It's pretty much like the photo. But the details are a little different. Also the armpit area is higher in real life than the photo. This can make you have a childish frame. It's up to you if you're okay with that.

OVERALL:
If you have boobs then I recommend it. If you're lacking in your chest don't get this!

This looks like a lovely dress in the photos, I'll give you that. As a frequent buyer of vintage- and retro-style dresses on Amazon, I have to say that this was the first absolute dud I've ever found. In person, the ACEVOG Vintage 1950's Floral Spring Garden Party Picnic Dress Party Cocktail Dress is a garish and cheap green, not the midcentury kelly green like the photo displays. The "sweetheart" neckline actually hits up at the collar bone, and the "full" midi circle skirt barely flounces. The "cotton blend" is very polyester, which gives it a bit of stretch and give, but doesn't allow the dress to flow like it should. I wore it once, bravely, and felt like I looked terrible. After one wash, the cheap hems flipped out and the fabric crinkled and shrunk into a tiny mess that now hangs on a modest hanger in the back of my closet. There are great retro dresses on Amazon. This is assuredly not one of them!

reviewText: This dress is so beautiful! I'm 5'4", about 110 lbs or so, and usually wear a size small. I wear a 32-A size bra, and have about a 28 or so inch waist. I ordered the small size, and it fit like a glove. It falls a few inches below my knees (I have a short torso with long legs compared to most women; not sure how that at impacts the length of this dress compared to most women, though I'm guessing it would be slightly shorter on most). The fabric is just slightly stretchy (but not a whole lot), just enough to keep me from feeling restricted in movement. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because the armholes are too small. They are quite tight under my armpits. Thankfully I can sew... I'm going to remove the binding around the holes with a seam ripper, cut the holes a bit bigger, then sew on new binding. That will make it PERFECT! :-D

This dress, it looks nice for the first day you wear it. but after that don't expect to wear it again. Nothing will take the wrinkles out. the material is stretchy which is nice but it lost its color and it wrinkles so it just looks terrible. also after the first wash, the hem started to roll up and just stay rolled, no amount of ironing or hang drying or gentle tumbling would get this dress to even out. I ended up giving it to good will because the hassle of a return is so ridiculous. The is the chance I take when I shop online, but I hope this review will help others to see the benefit of not purchasing this item and moving to something that is going to give them a little more bang for their buck. This dress, it not worth a buck.
